loans.name: Aleida Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con su sonrisa y gran corazón, Aleida ha tenido una gran acogida en su barrio desde que abrió su restaurante en casa hace 10 años con gran esfuerzo y con un deseo en su mente, el de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar utensilios de cocina y realizar una mejora locativa a su cocina.

Con estos ingredientes podrá continuar cocinando y preparando las delicias que con sus manos trabajadoras ha venido ofreciendo y sirviendo.
Su principal dificultad es la competencia.

Apoya a Aleida con su negocio y has que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo!
texts.en:
With her smile and big heart, Aleida has had a warm reception in her area since she opened her home restaurant ten years ago with a lot of hard work and one goal in her mind: to get ahead and improve her family's living conditions.

She is requesting a loan to buy cooking utensils and to make improvements to her kitchen space. With these ingredients, she will be able to continue cooking and preparing the delicacies that, with her hardworking hands, she has been able to offer and serve so far.

Her principal difficulty is competition.

Help Aleida with her business and make her life better with a loan!

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and and make improvements to her cooking space.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane, 49, has five children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Jane is the only one featured in this picture, she is representing her group of 15 farmers from Kenya's Matete District.

Jane started working with One Acre Fund in 2011 and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds available. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year she decided to represent her group because she wants to help more farmers.

Jane’s group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres. In addition, some of the group members will purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Cresent's Group

texts.en:
Cresent is a 71-year-old proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 12 farmers from the Matete district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Cresent has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Cresent described his harvest as good last year but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing two solar lights in addition to fertilizer and maize because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Cresent’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a slush machine to prepare cocktails.

loans.name: Sifrose's Group

texts.en:
Sifrose, 30, is a proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kenya's Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Sifrose has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Sifrose described her harvest last year as good but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is also very excited to be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because her children will now have light to study during dark hours. With her profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Sifrose’s group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Alfinnny's Group

texts.en:
Alfinnny is a 52-year-old proud mother of 9 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Alfinnny has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Alfinnny described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Alfinnny’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Starnly's Group

texts.en:
Starnly, pictured above, has been a farmer for 10 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers from the Matete District. He is 35 years old, is married and has five children.

Starnly likes to think of himself as a very resourceful person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has allowed him to consistently feed his family. Starnly plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Starnly’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate five acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mamine's Group

texts.fr: Mamine qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à gauche, et qui portant un foulard noir et tenant la pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 13 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Ouoronina au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Mamine, âgée de 52 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 13 à 34ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Mamine à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 46ans. Mamine cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Mamine entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement  et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Mamine effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro des semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0,125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 37ans que Mamine cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Mamine planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée et acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Mamine espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille et contribuer au financement  du  mariage de ses  enfants.
texts.en:
Mamine, appearing at the left in the first row, wearing a black scarf, and holding a myAgro pouch, is a member of a group of thirteen farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Ouoronina, southwest of Bamako, in Mali. She is 52 years old and the mother of five children, aged 13 to 34, of whom five are currently in school. 

Mamine is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, she was encouraged to do this work, as well as for the love of farming, for 46 years. She grows peanuts on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain and of farm supplies. 

Mamine is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system and the possibility of increasing her yields through the services offered by myAgro. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her parcel of 0.125 hectare. She has been growing peanuts for 37 years for its commercial as a staple food. She explains that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and are used in cooking as a sauce base. Peanuts also have commercial value, since she sells them on the market.

With greater yields and higher income, Mamine is planning on extending her arable land. Ultimately, she hopes also to be able to build a house for the family and help finance her children’s marriages.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shiny, silk and German thread to make traditional clothes.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Gaspar es un hombre de 55 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de ocho hijos de las edades entre 35 y 12 años algunos de ellos ya están casados, pero otros aún están bajo su cuidado, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Gaspar con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, gracias a esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.
Gaspar ahora deberá cultivar en la temporada de lluvia que ya se acerca, aunque el ya empezó a preparar la tierra una de sus dificultades es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes es por ello que solicita un crédito de Q. 5,000.00.
Gaspar tiene las esperanzas de conseguir este crédito para poder cultivar y obtener muy buenas ganancias, el sueño más grande de Gaspar es poder construir su casa y comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Gaspar is 55 years, and is married with a lovely family of eight children between the ages of 12 and 35. Some of his children are already married, while others are under Gaspar's care. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

Gaspar has been working in agriculture for 20 years in order to generate income and provide for his family. Thanks to this work, he has been able to support his large family. Now that the rainy season is coming, Gaspar has already started preparing the land, but he does not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer. For this he is requesting a loan of Q. 5,000.00. 

Gaspar hopes to use this loan to grow his farm and generate good earnings. Gaspar's biggest dream is to be able to build his own house and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Oyara Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA OYARA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana, la socia continua con su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes entre otros.
Los socios agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se comprometen  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of “VIRGEN ASUNTA OYARA” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, province of La Convención, department of Cusco.
Member Juana, continues to work selling and breeding animals, to later on sell to any customer requesting them. She is very responsible and hard working and she wants to keep working to support her family.
She wants to use the loan to buy guinea pigs and among other things.
All members are very thankful to be part of this dream thanks to the chance they were given and are committed to repay this loan according to the agreed schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and others.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as, honest. 

Nyevu operates a retail business and sells sugar, flour, bread, sweets, soap and other items. She has been in this business for two years. Her store is located in a busy area and her primary customers are good. 

Nyevu says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more bread, milk, flour, salt, sugar and other items. 

She hopes to become very successful. This is her fourth loan with SMEP microfinance bank loan. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, flour, salt, sugar and other items.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has eight children. He describes himself as competent. He operates a farm, growing maize and raising cows. He has been involved in this business for five years. 

John's business is located in a productive area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge as bad weather. 

John has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

John hopes he will have stable income in the future. He will use his anticipated profits to plant on more land.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man. He has 1 child. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are individuals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, bread and other items. His business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, bread and other items.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en: Charo is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself as sincere. He operates a retail business where he sells firewood. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are good. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes. 40,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. His business goal is to have a successful business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of firewood.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, cooking oil,sugar, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items.

His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better future for his family. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to enable him buy farm inputs such as fertilizers to increase the agricultural produce after sales of milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to meet the demands of his clients with a milk supply.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Robert, a 27 year old farmer from Katheri village in Central Kenya. Robert was born fifth among sixth siblings. As for his own family, he is single with no kids. He started farming five years ago on a two acre plot he acquired. On the farm, he has two dairy cows and a small garden equipped with an irrigation kit.

Robert is seeking a KES 50,000 loan which he will use to pay for farm inputs and hired labour in order to grow more crops on the farm.

It takes a lot for a smallholder farmer to risk limited resources to expand a farm business. With your help, Robert will be able to settle the high cost of farm inputs necessary for expansion.

A significant portion of the profit will be ploughed back into the business to fuel growth as he sets a good foundation for his future responsibilities as the head of the family.

loans.use: to grow more crops on his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Erisa

texts.en: Erisa is 52 years old, a hard working married man with five children living in Kasese Uganda. Erisa owns a general store and also earns a salary as an additional source of income. He has a dream of making a wholesale business. However, he is faced with the challenge of limited capital which reduces his returns. Erisa will use the loan to buy crates of sodas, maize flour, eggs, salt and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of sodas, maize flour, eggs, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a very hardworking person who, thanks to her daily effort, has achieved getting her children ahead, providing them a good quality education. Margaret has been practicing mixed farming for the last 36 years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and earn extra cash, she has engaged in another small personal business.

The Nyamira area is very populated, and demand for poultry products, including eggs, is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She says the most enjoyable part of poultry farming is, “The increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the high demand. She lacks the funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy poultry.

It is very challenging for a woman to access funds, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved to know that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through this loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and the local market, and this will translate into increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, Margaret intends to accumulate more profits and broaden her poultry business to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. She will use the extra income to fully repay the loan, change her living conditions and secure the future of her family and siblings.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Doña Norma es una esforzada y humilde mujer de 56 años, que se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 11 años. Ella ha logrado invertir en su negocio comprando  granos básicos, carnes, verduras, las cuales, son de gran demanda y le generan mejores ganancias.

Ahora doña Norma solicita un crédito ya que desea comprar aceite, arroz, frutas, carnes para continuar su negocio, ya que así podrá comprar a un mejor precio y mayor cantidad de producto. Las metas de doña Norma son continuar invirtiendo y trabajando duro en su negocio para poder darle una buena educación a su hija menor.
texts.en:
Norma is an earnest and humble 56-year-old woman, who has been working in food sales for 11 years. She has been able to invest in her business by purchasing grains, meats, and vegetables, which are in high demand and generate the best earnings.

Now Norma is requesting a loan so that she may buy oil, rice, fruit, and meat to continue her business. It will allow her to buy greater quantity at a better price. Norma's goals are to continue investing and working hard in her business to be able to provide a good education for her younger daughter.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, fruit, and meat to continue her business.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 55 years old and has 6 children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Margaret is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 8 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Margaret started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Margaret’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Gladys is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by nine farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Gladys started working alongside One Acre Fund a in 2011 and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Gladys’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
The person appearing on the photo is Rose, 59. She is married and blessed with two children who are attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from savings mobilization and enterprise development training.

Rose does tailoring, making and selling clothes. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more tailoring cloth to make more clothes, hence earn more income to meet her family's basic needs, e.g., food and clothing.

Rose is grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring cloth to make more clothes, hence earn more income to meet her family's basic needs, e.g., food and clothing.

loans.name: Rokia's Group

texts.fr: Rokia qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, et qui porte un T-shirt rouge et tient le drapeau myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Ticko au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Rokia, âgée de 35 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 1 à 17 ans, dont 7 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Rokia à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 27ans. Rokia cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de semences de qualité . Rokia entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement  et des semences de qualité . Cette année Rokia effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro des semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0,0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 27ans que Rokia cultive l'arachide pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Rokia planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée et acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Rokia espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi que le mariage des enfants.
texts.en:
Rokia, appearing at the right in the first row, wearing a red T-shirt, and holding a myAgro flag, is a member of a group of seven farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Ticko, southwest of Bamako, in Mali. She is 35 years old and the mother of eight children, aged 1 to 17, of whom seven are currently in school. 

Rokia is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, she was encouraged to do this work for 27 years. She grows peanuts on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain and of quality seeds. 

Rokia is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system and the quality seeds. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her parcel of 0.0625 hectare. She has been growing peanuts for 27 years for the productive and bargaining advantages of them. 

With greater yields and higher income, Rokia is planning on extending her arable land and buying farm supplies and equipment. Ultimately, she hopes also to be able to build a house for the family and help with her children’s marriages.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Mamadou's Group

texts.fr: Mamadou qui se trouve sur la photo  au deuxième rang à gauche et  portant un gros chapeau, est membre d’un groupe de 10agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Samanko au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Mamadou, âgé de 67 ans, est le père de 8 enfants âgés de 16 à 46ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Mamadou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 67ans. Mamadou cultive le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Mamadou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison des semences de qualité  et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Mamadou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro des semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 47ans que Mamadou cultive le maïs pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Mamadou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu   de diversifier les cultures et acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Mamadou espère aussi pouvoir  assurer l‘autosuffisance alimentaire dans sa famille.
texts.en:
Mamadou, appearing at the left in the second row and wearing a big hat, is a member of a group of ten farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Samanko, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. He is 67 years old and the father of eight children, aged 15 to 46, of whom six are currently in school. 

Mamadou is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, he was encouraged to do this work, as well as for the love of farming, for 67 years now. He grows corn on his parcel of land. But, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain and farm supplies. 

Mamadou is starting his first year with myAgro and signed up because of the quality seeds and the possibility of increasing his yields through the services offered by myAgro. This year, he is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn, so as to increase his yields on his parcel of 0.5 hectare. He has been growing corn for 47 years for its productive and market advantages. 

With greater yields and higher income, Mamadou is planning on diversifying his crops and purchasing some farm supplies and equipment. Ultimately, he also hopes to be able to ensure his family is self-sufficient in food.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Nokhaza

texts.en:
Nokhaza is a 44 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past seven years.  Her husband is the sole earner in his entire family. Nokhaza's husband wants to purchase a variety of commodities like rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business.  But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in suitable position to buy them. Therefore Nokhaza has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities for resale, and will also help him to earn maximum profitable income, to manage his household and business. 
Nokhaza is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: assist her husband, in increasing the inventory at his general store.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en: Johnstone is a married man. He has 9 children. He describes himself to be social. He operates a retail business where he sells food stuffs, cashew nuts, paraffin and other items. He has been involved in this business for 30 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of paraffin, cashew-nuts and other food stuffs. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of paraffin, cashew-nuts and other food stuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Mbithi

texts.en:
Mbithi is a married man with three children. He describes himself as loyal. He operates a retail fruit and vegetable selling business. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Mbithi's business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are good. He says his biggest business challenge is price fluctuations. 

He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a 30-year-old single woman from Dier El Balah city. She lives with her family in a small simple house. Israa works as an employee in a childcare center where she gets a low income. She also makes traditional meals and sells them at social events. It is a very profitable business but needs some improvements.

Israa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more tools for her kitchen. This will increase her productivity and also her income.

Israa appears in the photo while she was working.

loans.use: to buy more tools for her kitchen.

loans.name: Edelmira Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Edelmira del Carmen, una mujer ejemplo de emprendimiento y superación, a sus 60 años, viuda y con 5 hijos de los cuales todos ya formaron su familia,  se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, en el mercado local de Masaya, desde hace 10 años con ayuda de otras micro-financieras. Solicita crédito para reforzar su mercadería y así comprar blusas, faldas, pijamas y pantalones para sus diversas clientelas. Con ayuda de su negocio seguir ayudando con el crecimiento y educación de sus nietos.
texts.en: Edelmira del Carmen is an example of perseverance and entrepreneurship. She is 60 years old, a widow with 5 children with families of their own. For the last 10 years, she's been selling clothes at the local market in Masaya with help from other microfinance groups. She is asking for this loan to expand her stock offering by buying blouses, skirts, pajamas and pants to meet the needs of different customers. With the earnings from her business, she will be able to continue helping raise and educate her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skits, pajamas and pants for different customers.

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en: Jumaa is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as positive. He operates a retail business where he sells spare auto tires. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes. 20,000 loan to buy more stock of spares auto tires. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years.

loans.use: buy more stock of spare auto tires.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Paterna works hard to support her family.

She runs a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products. 

Paterna is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business.

Paterna has sustained her business activities because of seven previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 29 years old, married with one kid.

Julie works hard to provide for her family by runing a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Julie has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years.

Julie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 42 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are sent to school.

She earns a living by farming melons and vegetables in the Philippines. Nona is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nona has been farming melons and vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 55 years old, married with seven children.

Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Susana has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from nipa (a traditional style palm) roofing.

Susana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Naom

texts.en:
Hello! Introducing Naom, a 25-year-old mother who is full of energy and a very hard worker. She hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area with good and favourable weather patterns that support farming. She is the mother of five children who are under her care from her marriage. Naom completed her secondary school education thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents, but never advanced. This never killed the spirit she has for succeeding in life. Naom has been farming for the past fifteen years and through mixed farming, she has been able to take care of her family. She loves dairy farming.

Although Naom passionately loves farming, she faces the challenge of water shortages. Most of the rain water goes to waste, which is why she is seeking a loan to buy a water tank. Naom comes from an area where there is no piped water. Therefore this water tank will assist her to harvest water during the rainy seasons and also store water for home consumption. Harvested water will assist Naom to irrigate her farm, ensuring that there is a constant production of crops. This loan will turn around the life of Naom as she will no longer have to walk for long distances in search of this precious commodity water, hence saving her time.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Xenia Carolina

texts.es:
Xenia, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la alcaldía municipal y tiene dos hijos. 

Xenia, tiene su propio negocio de venta de productos de belleza desde hace 3 años, su tía fue quien le enseño acerca de la administración de este negocio, pues ella también se dedica a la venta de estos productos. Motivada por su tía y por las ganancias que genera este negocio, decidió trabajar de esta manera. 
 
Xenia, solicito un crédito para comprar productos de belleza, porque están en liquidación y sus precios son bajos, esto le dará la oportunidad de obtener mejores ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo y fortaleciendo su negocio. 

Los sueños de Xenia, son tener un bazar y una sala de belleza, también desea estudiar cosmetología, para prestar sus servicios en su propia sala de belleza.
texts.en:
Xenia is 23 years old and completed her secondary school studies. She is in a relationship, her partner works for the Municipal government and she has 2 children.

Xenia has had her own business selling beauty products for the past 3 years. Her aunt taught her how to administrate the business as she also sells these products. Motivated by her aunt and the profits that the business generates she decided to work in this way.

Xenia is requesting a loan to buy beauty products as they are in clearance and the prices are low. This gives her the opportunity to obtain greater profits and she can continue to invest and strengthen her business. Xenia's dream is to have a store and a beauty shop. She also wants to study cosmetology and offer her own services in her own beauty shop.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Nyasio

texts.en:
Nyasio is 34-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese Uganda. He sells and mines crude salt, having been in business for five years. It is his sole source of income.

He has a dream of being rich and starting up a retail business to supplement his income. He is faced with the problem of weather changes especially during the rainy season where business sales are very low. Nyasio has asked for a loan to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a very hardworking and helpful woman. Everything she does is for her family's benefit and well being. 

She lives in a humble home in the town of Nyamira, along her handsome husband and their two angelic-looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. 

Joyce has involved in agriculture for 15 years. She makes money by selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. 

Joyce is seeking a loan to buy cereal for resale. As her children grow older, their needs and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Joyce needs to boost her cereal selling business. 

With your loan, Joyce will be able to sell her cereals to her neighbors and at the local market. She will use the additional income to pay loan installments and, later on, school fees. 

All Joyce waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereal for resale.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
"Catherine is 50 years old and has 9 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Catherine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Catherine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Catherine's Group will be able to receive a total of 3 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Wafula's Group

texts.en:
Wafula is 47 years old and has 5 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Wafula has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Wafula also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Wafula's Group will be able to receive a total of 1 solar light, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 9 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Esther will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Esther plans to use the profits she gains this year to rent more land to cultivate in.

In total Esther’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 60 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by eight farmers in Matete district, Kenya. 

Margaret has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods; and although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by working alongside One Acre Fund. 

Margaret also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone.

Obtaining this loan means that Margaret's Group will be able to receive a total of two solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Khalayi's Group

texts.en:
Khalayi, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 15 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 2 children.

With a portion of this loan, Khalayi will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Khalayi plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Khalayi’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Sakwa's Group

texts.en:
Sakwa, pictured above, has eight children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group. Sakwa is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Sakwa has been a farmer for 16 years, and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light. He is very happy to be getting the light as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Sakwa is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 5.25 acres will be planted by Sakwa's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Bonface's Group

texts.en:
Bonface's Group is formed by ten farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Bonface, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 68 years old, married and has four children. Bonface has been a farmer for more than 50 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Bonface isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Bonface will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Bonface's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian es un hombre de 41 años de edad, está unido con su esposa con la que tiene tres hijos de las edades entre 20 y 15 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Julian con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y llevar el pan de cada día para su familia trabaja como empleado en una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes desde hace 6 años, el realiza esta actividad porque le gusta vender y porque es la mejor manera de sostener a su familia.
Julian es un padre de familia que ama y protege a su familia y es por ello que ahora se ve a la necesidad de remodelar su casa, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente por tal razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar sus materiales como, cemento, cal arena y hierro.
Julian guarda las esperanzas de conseguir este crédito, para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Julian is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and three children, ages between 20 and 15. This modest family lives in the community of Sololá.
Julian, always thinking about bringing money home to his family,  has been working at a grocery store for the last 6 years. He works there because he enjoys the retail business and because this is the best option he has to support his family.
Julian is the head of a family that he loves and protects and he now needs to remodel his home, but he is having a hard time saving up enough money, so he is asking for a loan to buy materials such as cement, lime, sand and iron beams.
Julian is hoping to get this loan to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, sand, iron beams to remodel his home.

loans.name: Moses's Group

texts.en:
Moses is a 66-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Moses has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Moses described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an improved overall quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Moses’s Group will be able to plant a total of 12.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Risper's Group

texts.en:
Risper is a 48-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of fourteen farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Risper has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Risper described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Risper’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of fourteen solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Shilpa Mahila Mandal -1 Group

texts.en:
Neetaben, 29, is the leader of this group of five women from Chankheda, in Ahmedabad district, located in the western Indian state of Gujarat. She is pictured standing in the middle of the above group. 

Household chores, one toddler and a retail micro-enterprise keep Neetaben busy throughout the day. Being hardworking and efficient, Neetaben loves the challenges posed by her responsibilities. Neetaben’s micro-enterprise retails different types of saris including, bandhani, plain and jari buti. 

She is hoping to expand her micro-enterprise but there are few sources of credit for a local entrepreneurs like Neetaben. High interest rates charged by local money lenders keep many small entrepreneurs out of the credit market. Though she's only completed her education to 10th grade - no small achievement for a woman in her town - she hopes to provide her child with a better future. Her search for credit led her to seek a crowd funded micro loan to expand her business. With this loan, Neetaben will increase her inventory of saris. This will help her offer customers a larger range to choose and attract new customers. 

Joining Neetaben on the path of business expansion are Bhartiben, Jashiben, Nilam and Soniben. They run micro-enterprises that deal in retail cloth-selling, papad (a local food item) manufacturing and utensil sales. 

Neetaben and her group seek a loan of Rs.75,000 to help them expand their businesses. Your loan will help them access credit on equitable terms. The loan will be administered by Prayas, a local organization based in Guajrat, that guides rural entrepreneurs in obtaining credit and improving their skills. 

Neetaben thanks you kindly on behalf of her group and their families for your contribution in helping them achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of sarees.

loans.name: Han Group

texts.en: Han is a 54-year-old married rice farmer with a dependent child who works, picking up peppercorns for payments. Han has cultivated rice for over 33 years. Her husband is a 54-year-old rice farmer as well. They reside in the Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $9 per day. Now Han, who is group leader, would like to request a group loan with four members. She will use her portion to buy foundation parts to build a latrine. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to build a latrine and live in hygienic conditions. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts to build a latrine

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 1, 6, 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva, paciente, solidaria, fuerte, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Sur de la ciudad; área residencial, muy poblada, casas antiguas y rústicas,  muchas sin acceso a servicios básicos, forman un lugar de comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas. De clima sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Maria es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello color castaño largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro, viste vestido a rayas horizontales rosas, cuelga un bolso negro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su motivación por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de verduras, venta de empanadas, venta de bisutería, tejido de carteras, venta de masitas, venta de desayunos, ferretería, carpintería y llantería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; majao encapao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), ají de panza (panza de res, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), y otros., actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado para la hora de almuerzo y cena, en las afueras de su domicilio protegida por 2 sombrillas y unas cuantas bancas para sentarse, “cocino algunas comidas tradicionales que aprendí a cocinar desde siempre y son las más populares, por eso es que mis ventas son buenas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la comida es muy bien aceptada por sus clientes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para inversión. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas, sillas y sombrillas para vender comida a más clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas y sombrillas para vender comida a más clientes.
texts.en:
María, 31, lives with her partner.  She has four children, ages 1, 6, 10, and 12.  She's understanding, patient, supportive, strong, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking, and she's a good mother.

Her business is selling traditional food.  She works in the southern area of the city, a well-populated residential area with rustic old houses, many without access to basic services, as well as commerce and manufacturing throughout.  The climate is sub-tropical, with temperatures that range from 21 to 35 degrees centigrade during the day.

María is short and dark and of average build; she has brown eyes and wears her brown hair tied back.  Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family; she speaks Spanish for cultural reasons and for business purposes.  (She's in the middle, wearing a dress with pink horizontal stripes and carrying a black purse.)

She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and her children, who attend school, except for the youngest, who is not yet of school age.  They live in their own room built of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof; they have potable water, electricity, and gas.

María's desire to improve her business led her to form a group of people to request a loan and improve their businesses: vegetable sales, empanada sales, costume jewelry sales, weaving wallets, pastry sales, breakfast sales, a hardware store, carpentry, and a tire shop.  Her business is selling traditional food: "majao encapao" (ground jerky, boiled plantains, and rice), peanut soup, stuffed locoto (locoto peppers, ground meat, onions), rice with cheese (rice, milk, and cheese), "ají de panza" (beef belly, onions, and tomatoes served with rice), and other dishes.  She works from Monday through Saturday during lunch and dinner, outside her home protected by two umbrellas and a few benches as seating.  "I cook some traditional dishes that I have always known how to prepare, and they're the most popular.  That's why I have good sales," she said.

The advantage of her business is that her customers enjoy her food.  The disadvantage is that she lacks capital for investing.  Her dream is to open a restaurant.

María wants to expand her business with a purchase of tables, chairs, and umbrellas to sell food to more customers, so she's requesting a loan.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the two years she has been in this line of work.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and umbrellas to sell food to her customers

loans.name: Soraya Shomar

texts.es:
Soraya es una joven mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de comercio internacional. 
Ella es inteligente, responsable, comprometida, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible y sincera. Sus estudios lo realiza en la universidad tecnológica ubicada en la zona central; área caracterizada por encontrarse rodeada de edificios que albergan a oficinas comerciales, públicas, restaurantes, plazas y todo tipo de comercios, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados.
Soraya es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no utiliza porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a su prima, porque sus padres viven en otra ciudad, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella cursa la carrera de comercio internacional y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta conocer diferentes entornos físicos, sociales, culturales y organizacionales, cuenta con habilidad para el manejo de la comunicación oral y escrita, se destaca por su amplio criterio y mentalidad receptiva a los cambios, se interesa por desarrollar aptitudes de liderazgo y creatividad, su espíritu es de mejora continua, “busco expandir mis fronteras, realizar contactos con empresas y abrir una agencia aduanera…” comenta. La ventaja de su carrera profesional es que el comercio es el centro de la economía, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para solventar todas sus necesidades. Su sueño es salir profesional para abrir una agencia aduanera y desea pagar las cuotas de su carrera por adelantado para conseguir un descuento. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Soraya solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su carrera profesional, terminar sus estudios y abrir una agencia.
texts.en:
Soraya is a young woman of 24 years old, single, childless, and is studying international trade. She is intelligent, responsible, committed, consistent, sweet, loving, sensitive and sincere. She attends the technological university located in the central area of her city, which is characterized by buildings that house commercial and public offices, restaurants, plazas and all kinds of shops. The climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies between 4-16 degrees Celsius during the day. Soraya is of dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears loose. She is short in stature and slender. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she does not use now because she studies and lives in the city. 

Because her parents live in another city, Soraya lives with her cousin in their own home that has potable water, electricity and sewerage. She is in the second year of a five-year program and enjoys getting to know different physical, social, cultural and organizational contexts. She has ability to handle oral and written communication, and is known for her comprehensive approach and mentality that is responsive to change. Soraya is interested in developing leadership skills and creativity; hers is a spirit of continuous improvement. "I'm looking forward to expanding my boundaries, making contacts with companies and opening a customs agency ..." she says. 

The advantage of this major is that trade is the center of the economy; the downside is the lack of money to solve all your needs. Soraya’s dream is to graduate as a professional in order to open a customs agency. She wants to pay the fees of her educational program in advance to get a discount. This is her first sequence of loans during the two years of her professional study. It is for these reasons that Soraya is requesting a loan: to pay the fees of her professional program, finish her studies and later open a customs agency.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her professional degree program, finish her studies and open a customs agency.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 54 year old farmer, married to Francisca, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with five children, ages 28, 26, 25, 16 and 12. 

He has had a farming business for 10 years, earning a monthly income of about KES. 45,000. He borrowed KES. 70,000 from VisionFund Kenya for his first loan. 

And Godfrey will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, pesticides and to hire labor. He hopes the anticipated profit will help him buy food for his family, pay school fees for his kids, cater to family medical care, expand his farming business and pay to transport his farm products to the market.

Godfrey's hopes and dreams are to have a stable farm, secure more markets for his farm products and enjoy an improved life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, pesticides and hire labor.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is married with two children. She describes herself as sincere and operates a retail business where she sells fish. Sidi has been involved in this business for six years. 

Sidi's business is located in a populated area, and primary customers are of all types. Her biggest business challenge is having low stock. 

Sidi will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more fish. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marjunil

texts.en:
Marjunil is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming rice and general store businesses.

Marjunil dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 62 years old, married with three children. She has run a general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Marlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like soap, sugar, canned good and other personal care products.

Marlyn has borrowed and repaid six prior loans from NWTF. 

Marlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 60 years old and married with five children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Helen has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Helen aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Linne

texts.en:
Linne is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Linne is 32 years old and both of her children are in school.

Linne has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. Linne has been in this business for ten years. In the future, She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 26 años de edad vende ropa y calzado de contado y a crédito entre vecinos y amigos; para ello compra a mayoristas y obtiene descuentos que le permiten ser competitivo; aun así como su capital no es suficiente para responder a la demanda del mercado, está aplicando a un   credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante  el cual comprará mercancías variadas, como ropa, calzado, relojes cadenas entre otros artículos. Con esta inversión planea incrementar sus ventas teniendo nuevos inventarios haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.  Carlos inició su actividad comercial hace 5 años, cuando estuvo desempleado y logró obtener un capital para comprar artículos y venderlos en un mercado doméstico, en el cual le fue bien y este hecho fue definitivo para impulsarlo a genera de manera autónoma sus propios ingresos. Hoy trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche diariamente y ofrece su mercancía de contado y a crédito, comprando en distribuidores mayoristas que le ofrecen opciones de precios ajustados a la realizad de su mercado. Su meta más adelante es tener su propio almacén y a futuro adquirir  su propia vivienda, lo cual es su sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Carlos is 26 year sold and sells clothing and footwear in cash and on credit to friends and neighbors. To do this he buys from wholesalers and gets discounts that allow him to be competitive. His capital is not great enough to respond to demand from the market.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva which is his first loan that he has made through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy a variety of merchandise like clothing, footwear, watches and chains amongst other items. With this investment he plans to increase his sales having new inventory making this a successful loan from Kiva.

Carlos started his business 5 years ago when he was unemployed and manged to get the capital to buy some merchandise and sell it in the domestic market. This went well for him and was key to guiding him to generating his own money in this way.

Today he works from 8 in the morning until 9 at night and offers his merchandise in cash and on credit. He buys from wholesale distributors that offer him options with prices adjusted to the reality of the market. His goal is to later on have his own store and in the future his own house. That is his dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise like clothing, footwear, watches and chains amongst other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, her husband and two children live in the Shenik village of Armavir region. Mary's children attend a local secondary school in the village, while Mary  and her husband run their family farm. 

On the farm, they cultivate watermelon and sell it during the peak season. They also keep livestock of 14 cows and 21 calves. The farm is big, so both Mary and her husband work hard to sustain it and earn income for their family's living. To be able to improve her farm, Mary applied for this loan. She needs to purchase seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation, and forage for feeding the livestock. 

This is Mary's second loan. She faced difficulties in paying back her first loan to another financial institution because of hard financial times for her family. Now, thanks to tireless work and ensuring that her farming business is sustainable enough to cover monthly loan payments, Mary has applied for this loan. 

Mary has been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Through this program, more than 600 loans were disbursed, 80% of which were funded and helped individuals like Mary to develop their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation, and forage for feeding her livestock.

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Musa, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by ten farmers in Matete District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to four children, and is known by his community as a very trustworthy person.

Initially, Musa joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to earn enough to send his children to school. Since he joined the program, he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to save more money. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Musa plans to buy a cow.

Between the ten farmers in Musa's Group, a total of 6.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi is a proud mother of two sons. Together with her husband, Taguhi runs a farm, while their sons work at a local factory. 

The farm which Taguhi runs includes greens and other crop types. Agricultural income is very important for her family's living, so both Taguhi and her husband work hard to develop it. 

To be able to purchase two oxen and enrich her farm with the livestock, Taguhi applied for this loan. This is her first loan, so it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old and has 12 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Mary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Mary also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Mary's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en: 29-year-old Giorgi lives in a village in rural Kakheti region. He is married with two children and is expecting a third child. In his primary job, he works as a craftsman. But this does not generate enough income for the growing young family. So Giorgi will install and cultivate his own vineyard for extra income. Growing wine has a millennia-long tradition in Kakheti. The loan allows him to buy the necessary poles and wire.

loans.use: to buy poles and wire for a new vineyard in order to earn additional income for his young family.

loans.name: Mulehi's Group

texts.en:
Mulehi is a 65-year-old proud father of 8 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mulehi has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Mulehi described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Mulehi’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years. She is proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Matete district, in Kenya. She is 40 years old, married and has six children.

Joyce likes to think of herself as a very trustworthy. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Joyce plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Joyce’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.25 acres of land and two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Tshepo

texts.en:
Tshepo is married and has four children. He is an inspiration to his community because of his resilient attitude to progress in life. 

Tshepo left employment as a builder and started selling small plumbing equipment on the street. He has now managed to rent a shop and has increased his stock to include a variety of construction products. He is requesting a loan to further increase his trade by buying electrical supplies, such as PVC cables and light switches, and to also stock cement for sale. 

Tshepo's passion for business is an inspiration to the community. He is seen as an outspoken leader within the community and always spares time to give advice and motivate youth in his area. He aspires to own a hardware store that can provide employment to as many people as possible.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies and to stock cement for sale.

loans.name: Yaziwe

texts.en:
At 59, when many are retiring to a comfortable life of pension, Yaziwe is starting an Early Childhood Development center (ECD). She has worked with children all her life and believes that through guidance and knowledge children have the ability to change their community.

Yaziwe is requesting for a loan to buy educational materials, an electric cooking stove, tables, and chairs. The loan, she says, will be a big boost towards achieving her dream.

She aspires to grow the center and have enough space and resources to introduce a feeding program for the whole community.

loans.use: to buy educational materials, specifically books and puzzles, as well as chairs, tables, and a cooking stove.

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a 39-year-old divorced mother of three children, who has been selling women clothes for seven years. Profits cover the needs and expenses of her beloved kids. She is the breadwinner of her family and tries hard to develop her business and improve their living conditions.

Today, Maysaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand her business and add a new section for children's clothes to satisfy her customers' special requests. 

Maysaa hopes to expand her business in the future to stay capable of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to open a new section in her store for children clothes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
