texts.en: Nurchagul is 36, married and the mother of three children. She has a university education and is a teacher. She also works a second job at a pharmacy and has been raising livestock and planting crops for ten years. Thanks to her hard work she currently has a 2.88 hectare plot of land where she grows beans, as well as a cow and 28 sheep. She earns an average of 15,000 som (KGS) per month. Nurchagul applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy seeds, fertilizers, and ten sheep to fatten. She will use the earnings from the loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing organic beans and ten sheep for fattening

loans.name: Consolata's Group

texts.en:
Consolata, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group that is formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she likes being a leader. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Consolata will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that that she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. Consolata plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

Consolata’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lendrosh

texts.en:
Lendrosh is an auto repair specialist from Kapan town. He has been working from a rented garage for three years. Lendrosh lives with his wife and 13-year-old son. He is the main breadwinner in the family, so he needs to work hard to cover their daily living costs. 

He has applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials for his auto repair service. He needs this loan to improve his working tools and provide better quality service to his clients. 

Lendrosh has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides  start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for his auto repair service.

loans.name: Maoline

texts.en:
Maoline is 39 years old and married to Makori. She supports eight family members. Maoline has been selling chips in the market for the last five years and the business earns her a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the money to buy a dairy cow, which will then enable her to purchase more stock of potatoes and oil so as to make more chips for her customers. 

Maoline will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and open a hotel where she will sell her chips. Her future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, which will enable her to buy more stock for her chip-selling business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael (aged 39) is a talented carpenter who specializes in making ironing boards and picnic tables. He is married and has two children, aged 13 and five. Michael was previously employed as a salesman in a timber yard. It was here that he learned his trade and started his own carpentry shop. His salesmanship has allowed him to excel as he understands how to relate to customers, and also knows what they need (hence his specialization is only two products).

Michael is requesting a loan to buy a second wood panel saw machine. This addition will allow him to employ a third person, thereby increasing his production capacity.

Michael  is a hard worker with a keen eye for business. He aspires to create employment opportunities in his area through woodwork.

loans.use: to buy a second wood panel saw machine.

loans.name: Astrit Maria

texts.es:
Astrit es una madre muy responsable de 4 hijos, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 

Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Astrit también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Astrit is a very responsible mother of four children. She has had to go through many challenges in her life, but she has always had the strength to get by and continue moving forward with her family. 

She began selling eggs a while back. She has a number of hens for that purpose which allow her to make a certain amount of sales. 

She dreams of seeing her business grow and knows that with help from Corporación Interactuar and the people supporting her business she will be able to achieve that. 

For this reason, she is seeking a loan that would help her buy more hens to be able to increase her capacity for egg production and thereby respond to customer demand for eggs.

In this way her sales will increase considerably and her business will also have a resurgence and be able to get ahead.

Astrit also wants to have a great business where she can use all the capacity possible to get ahead and thereby offer her children a more stable financial future.

loans.use: to buy more hens to be able to increase her capacity for egg production

loans.name: Claudio Gustavo

texts.es:
Claudio es un hombre de campo y padre de 2 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para el y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a un hombre trabajador con un préstamo!
texts.en: Claudio is a country man and the father of two children for whom he has gone through many adversities in his life. However, he has always had the strength to move ahead and continue progressing with his family. For a long time, he has wanted to open a business raising and selling chickens. This is why he is requesting a great financial encouragement to buy some chickens to raise and materials to build a barn. With this new business he will be able to generate income for his family, which is everything for him, and to improve the quality of life of his wife and his children. He will work every day to boost his business and make it a sustainable and profitable activity. Support a hardworking man with a loan!

loans.use: to buy some chickens to raise and materials to build a barn.

loans.name: Eliazer Eduardo

texts.es:
Eliazer, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltero y vive con su madre, su abuela y un hermano menor.

Eliazer, es agricultor en pequeño, siembra maíz, frijol, hortalizas, entre otros productos agrícolas, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, su padre fue quien le enseño a sembrar.- Además, se dedica a trabajar como jornalero, con lo cual genera un ingreso adicional para su casa, en épocas que no está laborando en sus cultivos.- Su lugar de trabajo está a 1 kilómetro aproximadamente, en algunas ocasión utiliza una carreta halada por una yunta de bueyes, para llegar hasta allí y su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.

Eliazer, necesita el dinero para alquilar la tierra donde trabajara y para comprar una yunta de bueyes.- Con eso quiere asegurar el lugar donde trabajara. 

Su sueño más grande es tener un terreno propio, para cultivar sus granos básicos.-
texts.en: Eliazer is 25 years old. He studied up to ninth grade. He is single and lives with his mother, grandmother and a younger brother. Eliazer is a small farmer. He grows corn, beans, vegetables, among other farming products. He has worked in this activity for 12 years. His father is the one who taught him to farm. Also, he works as a daily laborer, with which he generates extra income for his household, at times in which he is not working in his crops. His place of work is located at approximately one kilometer. Sometimes, he uses a cart pulled by a pair of oxen to get there, and his work schedule is of six hours a day. Eliazer needs money to rent the land that he will work, and to buy a pair of oxen. With this he wants to assure the place where he will work. His greatest dream is to have his own land where to cultivate his basic grains.

loans.use: to rent the land that he will work and to buy a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Ejemplo de hombre  trabajador y emprendedor, Don Gerado a sus 68 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de leña y también es agricultor, tiene 15 años de ejercer estas labores de las cuales se siente orgulloso porque ha podido sacar  adelante a su familia. Con ayuda de su nieto que le ayuda a cortar y transportar la mercadería.  Requiere del préstamo para la siembra de maíz, y con esto poder aumentar su ganancia y obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Don Gerado, 68 years old, is fine example of a hardworking man and entrepreneur. He buys and sells firewood and is also a farmer. He has 15 years experience performing this type of labor and feels proud for having been able to take care of his family with the help of his grandson who helps him cut and transport the products. He needs a loan to sow corn, and with this be able to increase his earnings and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sow corn

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es: Aquilino de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo, posee 10 años de experiencia en la actividad, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Aquilina, age 47, lives in his own house with his wife.  He grows corn, beans, and sorghum.  He has ten years of experience with this business activity.  He sells his products at the different markets that are close to his house.  With what he gets from his sales, he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies like fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.  He will also improve the land that is seen in the photo.  He will do this in order to be able to continue with his work.  This way he will be able to have better earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, juice, and candy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes to make chips

loans.name: Festus's Group

texts.en:
Festus, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group of nine farmers in Matete District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Festus will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore, save more money. Festus plans to use the profits he gains this year to send his children to school.

In total, Festus’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of five acres of land. They will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to add more stocks of products to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her to start a retail shop and meet her customers' demands for milk

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Meet Silas, a very industrious, honest and hardworking man from the Chuka area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya. Silas, 27, has been farming for the past 10 years. Through these years, he has gained much experience and is considered among the best farmers in his village. He practices mixed farming. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help him make ends meet. 

Silas is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating his farm. That is why, every day, he wakes up very early to go to his farm to plow. Although he makes profits from farming, he is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase his income by selling cereals. That is why he is seeking this loan: to buy cereal. Kenya's Chuka area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereal. This means that Silas could increase his profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Silas, but he now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring farmers like him turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Silas believes that this loan will be of much help, and that he will be able to satisfy the demand for cereal. He also believes that the extra income he earns will enable a permanent change in his life and improve his business. Increased profits will allow Silas to repay this loan and secure the future of his school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman and owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but has no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 
 
For the past five years, she has operated a plastics-selling business at the market. She mentioned competition and transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of jugs, bowls and cups for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase stock of jugs, bowls and cups for resale

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Joyce, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 33 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of nine farmers in Matete District, Kenya.  She is married and has three children.

Joyce is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to earn enough to feed her family, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Joyce says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Joyce will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Tisongmi Taba – Tamalgu Group

texts.en:
Mayisah is a 45-year-old married woman living with the husband and six children in Tamalgu, a community in Northern Ghana. She is the person raising her hand in the group picture. Their group is called ‘Tisongmi Taba – Tamalgu’ Women Association.

All the members are involved in the business of picking and processing shea nuts into shea crude butter. They have been in the business for the past four years. They process high premium shea crude butter, some of which is sold to aggregators in Ghana who then export to the European and USA markets. She sells the butter to many other customers in Ghana. The group is therefore requesting a loan of GHS 8,900 and Mayisah’s share of the loan is GHS 400, which she will use to buy and process shea nuts to make crude butter. 

She hopes to increase her income to help her family to have regular food to eat, to buy educational materials for her children in school and repay this loan.

Mayisah thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy and process shea nuts to make crude butter.

loans.name: Hilda De Jesus

texts.es: Hilda es una mujer que a sus 57 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de zapatos, actividad que lleva realizando 15 años, por lo que cuenta con una clientela sólida que siempre busca sus productos, por lo que su negocio cuenta con mucha rentabilidad. La vivienda de Hilda es muy humilde como se observa en la fotografía, pero ella se siente feliz de contar con un lugar donde vivir, sobre todo porque tiene a su cargo sus 2 nietos uno de 4 años de edad y el otro de 3 meses de edad. Siempre pensando en brindar lo mejor a su familia Hilda hace decidido invertir en su negocio, ya que sabe que es la mejor manera de mejorar sus ingresos económicos, pero al no contar con la liquidez económica necesaria solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cuero, suelas, hilo, etc., y de esta manera mejorar su negocio, ya que sabe que al invertir en el sus ingresos económicos serán mejores y contara con la estabilidad económica para cancelar este crédito.
texts.en: Hilda is a woman, who at 57 years of age works making shoes, an activity she has done for 15 years. As she comments, she has a solid customer base, who always looks for her products, and because of this, her business is very profitable. Hilda's house is very humble as one can observe on the photograph, but she feels happy to have a place where to live, specially because she is in charge of her two grandsons, who are 4 years old and 3 months old. Always thinking of giving the best to her family, Hilda has decided to invest in her business, because she knows that it is the best way to improve her financial income; but since she does not have the necessary financial liquidity, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: leather, soles, thread, etc., and in this way improve her business. She knows that when she invests in it, her financial income will be better and she will have the financial stability to pay off this loan.

loans.use: to invest in: leather, soles, thread, etc., to make shoes.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, rice, cooking oil, soap, flour, salt, and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a favourable place, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other items. His business goal is to open a mini supermarket within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул, 46 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Семья очень дружная и уважаемая в селе. Айнагул 20 лет занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 3 коровы, 12 телят, 10 овец, 10 коз. Всю прибыль от бизнеса Айнагул старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и сена для скота. Айнагул хочет развить ее бизнес, чтобы в будущем иметь возможность еще увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Ainagul is 46 years old, married, and she has three children.  Her family is very friendly and well respected in the village.  Ainagul has been involved in animal husbandry for 20 years.  Today, she is a successful farmer and her small farm comprises three cows, 12 calves, 10 sheep and 10 goats.  Ainagul tries to reinvest all her profits in the development of her business.  She has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a few sheep and some hay for her livestock.  Ainagul wants to develop her business, so that she can further increase her livestock headcount in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hay as feed for her livestock and also to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 60 years old and has eight children. She has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Mary is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group of 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Mary started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Mary’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in raw materials and to refurbish the cart she uses to sell French fries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to add more stock to her retail shop after milk sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es:
María, está atendiendo a nuevos clientes por lo que sus demandas son mayores, necesita de un nuevo crédito para comprar gas propano, maíz, leña, bolas y cal, para elaborar la venta de tortillas y así contar con la satisfacción de sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior ha mantenido su negocio con vida, la familia se mantiene unida y dándole apoyo para continuar trabajando.
texts.en: María is working with new customers which means her demand has increased. She needs a new loan to buy propane, corn, firewood, balls of dough and lime to make tortillas and satisfy her customers. With the previous loan she was able to maintain her business. Her family continues to be united and supportive of her work.

loans.use: to  buy propane, corn, firewood, balls of dough and lime to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 47 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Гулмиры среднее образование, работает учителем в школе, также в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1994 году. Благодаря упорному труду Гулмиры, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем около 10,500 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы, 30 овец, также на участке мерою 2,22 Га собственной поливной земли, она выращивает фасоль для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulmira is 47 years old, married, and she has two children.  She has a secondary education and works as a school teacher.  Since 1994, she has also been involved in animal husbandry and crop farming, two activities which bring another source of income home.  Thanks to her very hard work, Gulmira currently makes an average monthly income of about 10,500 som (KGS).  She has two dairy cows and 30 sheep on her farm.  She also owns 2.22 hectares of irrigated land on which she grows beans for resale and for the farm's own usage.  In order to further develop her business, Gulmira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy 10 sheep and some feed for her livestock.  She is planning to invest the earnings from her loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock as well as 10 sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Manuel Vicente

texts.es:
Manuel, de 74 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domesticos, tiene tres hijos, ninguno de ellos vive con ellos.

Manuel, tiene cuarenta años de dedicarse a la agricultura, este trabajo lo aprendió con sus padres y sus hermanos mayores, actualmente trabaja junto a su compañera de vida.

Con el crédito que está solicitando comprará fertilizantes, semilla, pagará el alquiler de tierra y pagara mano de obra para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

El sueño de Manuel, es poder sembrar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, y poder comprar ganado de repasto.
texts.en:
Manuel, 74, studied until the 3rd grade. He is married and his wife works in the home. They have three children, none of whom live at home any longer.

Manuel has been a farmer for 40 years. He learned the job from his parents and older brothers. He now works alongside his wife. With this loan he will buy fertilizers and seeds and pay rent on his land and pay laborers to plant 7000 square meters of corn.

Manuel's dream is to be able to plant 21,000 square meters of corn and to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay rent on the land and labor to plant 7000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Anastasio

texts.es: Anastasio vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de dedicarse a ese rubro el cual le han servido para poder salir adelante  con los gastos de su hogar, comercializa sus productos cerca de su lugar de residencia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y así poder preparar sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Anastasio lives in his own house with his family. He earns a living planting corn. He's been doing this work for various years, which has served him well in covering the household expenses. He sells his products close to his residence. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticide, etc. and to improve the plot shown in the photo and that way prepare his crops in order to generate better income.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticide, etc. and improve the soil.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, who all go to school. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Angella makes candles and operates her business on a retail basis from home. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO to buy raw materials for making candles. Her major challenge includes changes in the price of raw materials for making candles. Her goal and aspiration is to train more people in making different types of candles. She would like to get an electric machine for making candles so as to increase production.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making candles

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail shop where he sells clothes. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in season. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will open a boutique. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, con el crédito anterior tuvo oportunidad de tener el alimento suficiente para que los cerdos y el ganado se mantuvieran robustos y fuera fácil venderlos a un buen precio, con las ganancias a cumplido con todos sus compromisos.
Para María los créditos son de mucha importancia para ir mejorando su negocio y obtener los ingresos necesarios para subsistir con su familia, ella está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar cerdos, zacate y concentrados, seguirá mejorando la alimentación de los cerdos y el ganado.
texts.en:
With her previous loan María had an opportunity to buy sufficient food to keep her pigs and cattles fat and it was easy to sell them at a good price. With her earnings she was able to meet all of her commitments.

For Maria these loans are very important because she is able to continue improving her business and earning the income that she needs to sustain her family. She is asking for a new loan to buy pigs, hay, and concentrated feed so that she can continue feeding her pigs and cattle.

loans.use: to buy pigs, and hay, concentrated feed so that she can keep feeding her pigs and cattle.

loans.name: Bendiciones Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Bendiciones¨ conformado por 3 mujeres, deseosas de seguir ampliando sus negocios y así alcanzar metas. Solicitan crédito de ADIM para seguir progresando. Maritza es la coordinadora, tiene 27 años, ella y su acompañante trabajan el día a día para sustentarse económicamente, tienen 2 hijos de edades de 10 y 11 años. Ella tiene una Pulpería en su hogar, y desea el préstamo para compra de aceite y comprar 3 quintales de arroz. 
Sus compañeras de grupo, Darling Patricia, de 24 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos por catálogo de la Marca Zermat. Y Mayara Indira que se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene su pulpería en casa, invertirá el dinero en la compra de jeans, camisetas y licra deportivas, chiverías, gaseosas, jabón, y sopas instantáneas.
texts.en:
The group "Bendeciones" [Blessings] is made up of 3 women who want to grow their businesses and achieve their goals. They're asking for a loan from ADIM to continue their progress.

Maritza, 27, is the group's coordinator. She and her husband work every day to make ends meet. They have two children ages 10 and 11. She runs a small grocery store in her home and wants a loan so that she can buy oil and 3 large bags of rice.

Her partners in the group are: Darling Patricia, 24, who sells clothing and other products from the Zermat catalog; and Mayara Indira who sells clothing and has a grocery store in her home. They will invest in jeans, tshirts, athletic clothing, snacks, sodas, soap and instant soup.

loans.use: to buy oil and 3 large bags of rice.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from two years to sixteen years. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail shop where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a favorable location and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, soap, flour, salt and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and convenient place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, soap, flour and other items. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, soap, flour and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood and six bags of corn to have raw material and maintain her business.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Christine will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Christine plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total, Christine’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Zhyrgalbek

texts.ru: Жыргалбек, 45 лет, женат, есть 3 дочери, младшей 9 лет. У Жыргалбека - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи он занимается животноводством и полеводством. Собственный бизнес начал 15 лет назад и развил его. В хозяйстве Жыргалбека есть 3 коровы, 8 овец. На 5,26 Га собственной земли выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Жыргалбека составляет до 10,000 сом (KGS). Он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Жыргалбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и постройку сараев для скота, также он мечтает накопить на приобретение автомобиля.
texts.en:
Zhyrgalbek is 45 years old, married, and he has three daughters (the youngest one is 9 years old).  Zhyrglbek has a secondary education.  He raises livestock and grows crops, two activities which constitute his family's main source of income.  He started his own business 15 years ago and has been able to develop it.  He currently has three cows and eight sheep on his farm.  He also owns 5.26 hectares of land on which he grows clover for resale and for the farm's own usage.  Today, he makes a monthly income of up to 10,000 som (KGS).  

Zhyrgalbek has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a few young bulls for fattening and resale.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further grow his business and to build barns for his livestock.  He is also dreaming about saving enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase young bulls for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Fanuel's Group

texts.en:
Fanuel is 76 years old and is often referred to as a really reliable person. As a group leader, he is representing a group formed by 10 farmers including himself from Matete district.

Fanuel has been a farmer for 18 years and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2011 because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan but also a solar light in order to have light during the night to feel safer. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

With this loan, Fanuel’s Group will receive a total of 7 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Donaldo Jose

texts.es:
Donaldo es un hombre emprendedor y que lucha arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia como Mecánico Automotriz. Él ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio para brindarles a sus clientes un excelente servicio.   
Ahora él está solicitando un crédito ya que desea invertir en artículos para su taller como son: cortadoras, afiladoras, aceites, llaves, etc.,  ya que si invierte más en el trabajo que hace gana más ingresos para su familia. Los planes de Donaldo son construir una pared para la división de su casa.
texts.en:
Donaldo is an enterprising man who has worked hard as an auto mechanic to provide for his family. 

He has been able to improve the conditions of his business and give his clients and excellent service. 

He is currently requesting a loan to invest in items for his workshop such as: cutters, sharpeners, oils, keys, etc. If he invests more in his work he will have more income for his family. 

Donaldo plans to build a wall to divide his house.

loans.use: to invest in items for his workshop such as: cutters, sharpeners, oils, keys, etc.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela, featured in the photo, is representing her farming group of 12 farmers from the Matete district, Kenya. She is 38 years old and a married mother of seven children. She is often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Pamela has been a farmer for 16 years, she is new to One Acre Fund. She decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Pamela wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Pamela hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights as, even though Pamela decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Las Bellas De Chicua Ii Group

texts.es:
Tomasa es una señora de 29 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo de un año, esta humilde mujer vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Tomasa (es la señora de en medio de blusa morada) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sostener a su familia desde hace cinco años se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica de su región, ella eligió esta actividad porque lo aprendió de su mama, pero también porque es bastante rentable.
Tomasa es una mujer que para lograr sus objetivos a buscadas estrategias, es por eso que ahora se ha unido a un grupo de personas para poder solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en su pequeño negocio de elaboración de ropa típica comprando hilos de tipo, seda, alemán y lustrina, ella y su grupo tienen las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder realizar la mejorar la calidad de su negocio.
Tomasa tiene el gran deseo de contar con un local donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 29, is single and has a one-year-old son. She is a humble woman who lives in the community of Chichicastenango. Tomasa (the women in the middle in the purple blouse) wanted to earn an income to help sustain her family, and so five years ago she started making typical regional clothing. She chose this activity because she learned it from her mother, but also because it's pretty profitable.

Tomasa is a woman who searches for ways to achieve her goals, and that's why she has now joined with a group of people to ask for a loan to invest in her small clothing production business. She will buy different types of thread like silk, German and alpaca.

She and her group hope to continue with the loans in order to be able to improve the quality of their businesses. Tomasa hopes to have a store where she can better show off her products so that she can make more profits.

loans.use: to buy various types of thread including silk, German and alpaca in order to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Cachito De Cielo Group

texts.es: El  grupo solidario “Cachito de Cielo” es un grupo mixto formado por un hombre y dos tres mujeres. Todos ellos empresarios, se reunieron para acceder a la financiación para sus pequeños negocios. Argelia de 66 años, ejemplo para muchos de superación y progreso, se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y pelibuey desde hace 15 años. Inicio su negocio con la ayuda de los ingresos obtenidos por la venta de frutas en un mercado nacional. Con su crédito desea comprar concentrado, vacunas, alimentos y vitaminas para así ofrecer una calidad sanitaria mejor a sus clientes. Los otros miembros, Mercedes Ramón  de 56 años, hombre luchador que se dedica a la venta de refrescos de manera ambulante; Petronila de 27 años vende ropa nuevas y perfumes; Yerlin de 34 años se dedica a la venta comida en su casa y por encargos
texts.en:
The group “Cachito de Cielo” is a mixed group made up of one man and two or three women. They are all entrepreneurs. They came together to gain access to financing for their small businesses. 

Argelia, 66, is an example for many of improvement and progress. She has bred and sold pigs and sheep for the past 15 years. 

She started her business with the help of income from selling fruit at the national market. 

With her loan she wants to buy concentrate, vaccines, feed and vitamins in order to offer better health quality to her clients. 

The other members are:  Mercedes Ramón, 56, a hard working man who is a soft drink selling street vendor.  Petronila, 27, sells new clothing and perfumes. Yerlin, 34, sells food in her house and by order.

loans.use: to buy concentrate, vaccines, feed and vitamins in order to offer better health quality.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to add more shoe soles and glue for repairing his clients' damaged shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Gadobegim

texts.ru: Гадобегим 60 летняя веселая жительница района Пяндж. Этот приграничный район находится рядом с границей Афганистана. Гадобегим вместе с семьей проживает здесь довольно долго. Она мать троих детей. Гадобегим с детьми занимается растениеводством, так как найти другую работу очень тяжело. В этом году у Гадобегим и ее семьи не хватило денег на приобретения семян и минеральных удобрений, и она приняла решение обратиться за кредитом, так как ей больше не кому обращаться. Поддержите Гадобегим.
texts.en: Gadobegim is 60 years old and she has a positive attitude in life.  She lives in the Pyandj district of Tajikistan, located not far from the Afghan border. She and her family have been living here for a long time. Gadobegim has three children and they all work in agriculture because it is very difficult to find another job.  This year Gadobegim and her family don't have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  For this reason, she has decided to apply for a loan because she has no one else to turn to.  Please support her.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул, 41 год, замужем, есть 7 детей. У Нургул средне-специальное образование, работает оператором в территориальном органе самоуправления, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 2002 года занимается  полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Нургул в хозяйстве имеется 1,50 Га собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земельной доли, на которой она выращивает фасоль. В общей сложности деятельность Нургул приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистой фасоли. Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nurgul is 41 and married with seven children. She has a specialist high school education and works as an operator at a territorial self-government institution. She also has been working in agriculture since 2002 as an additional source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work she has 1.5 hectares of her own and 2 hectares of rented land where she grows beans. On average, her business brings in about 8,000 KGS per month.

With the goal of further developing her business, Nurgul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase seeds and fertilizers to work the soil and grow organic beans. She plans to put profits from the loan into further improving her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow organic beans

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз, 32 года, замужем, 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает воспитателем в детском саду, получая заработную плату в размере 6,500 сом (KGS). Супруг - слесарь газовых сетей низкого давления. Дилафруз аккуратная, спокойная, трудолюбивая. Дилафруз обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на проведение ремонта в доме. Доходы от заработной платы она планирует вкладывать в дальнейший ремонт дома.
texts.en: Dilafruz is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a college education and she works as a preschool teacher, making a salary of 6,500 som (KGS).  Her husband works as an operator on low pressure gas networks.  Dilafruz is conscientious, quiet and hardworking.  She has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to perform some repairs at home.  She is planning to use her salary to further renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to perform some repairs at home.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Аигул 50 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У нее высшее образование. Аигул работает в городском парламенте, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес 15 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Аигул, в хозяйстве есть земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА, на котором она выращивает картофель для реализации. Ее деятельность приносит около 18,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аигул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и удобрений. Доходы от кредита Аигул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Aigul is 50 years old, married, and she has three children.  She has a college education and works for the city council.  In order to provide an additional source of income for her family, she is also involved in agriculture, an activity she started 15 years ago.  Thanks to her very hard work, her farming business comprises two hectares of land on which she grows potatoes for resale.  She makes 18,000 som (KGS) every month from this activity.  Eager to further grow her business, Aigul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy seed potatoes and fertilizers.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and fertilizers in order to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.es:
José, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, debido a los escasos recursos de sus padres, es por eso que se dedico al trabajo de la agricultura y actualmente vive con sus padres.

José, tiene cinco años de dedicarse a la agricultura, este trabajo lo aprendió junto a su padre y a su abuelo.

El crédito que está solicitando lo necesita para cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, el comprará siete sacos de abono, semilla, fertilizantes y pagara la mano de obra.

El sueño de José, es poder sembrar otros 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, para generar muchas más ganancias; también pretende construir su casa y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
José, 21, studied up to 9th grade due to the poor economic circumstances of his parents. 

This is why he started working in agriculture. He currently lives with his parents. 

José has been working in agriculture for 5 years. He learned this work from his father and grandfather. 

He is requesting a loan to cultivate 21,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans. He will buy 7 bags of fertilizer, seed and pay for the day labor. 

José's dream is to cultivate another 14,000 square meters of corn in order to generate more income. He also wants to build his own house and have a family.

loans.use: to buy 7 bags of fertilizer, seed and pay for day labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent the land where he will work this season and to be able to buy nets for fishing.

loans.name: Saidahmad

texts.ru: Саидахмад серьезный и ответственный человек. Он житель города Вахдат. Ему 46 лет. Саидахмад женатый человек, и имеет троих детей. Детям 8 и 6 лет, третий еще маленький. Жена занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. У Саидахмад имеется помещения, он планирует открыть  цех для производство пластиковых стол - стульев.  Ему нужно купить приборы для производство стол – стульев. По этой причине Саидахмад обратился за кредитом. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему достичь своих целей.  Саидахмах верит в Вас и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Saidahmad is a serious and responsible person and a resident of the city of Vahdat. He is 46 and married with three children. Two are aged eight and six and the third is still small. His wife works in agriculture and he has a space where he plans to open a workshop to produce plastic tables and chairs. He needs to purchase equipment for making these tables and chairs. For this reason he is requesting a loan. The loan amount will help him achieve his goals. Saidahmad trusts in you and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to produce plastic tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation.

Esther will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be able to import clothes within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Nduta

texts.en:
Nduta is a married woman with five children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells curtains. She has been involved in this business for twenty years. Her business is located in an area with high customer inflow and her primary customers are locals.

Nduta describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 65,000 loan to buy more stock of curtains. She hopes that in the future, she will own a boutique. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of curtains.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
At 45 years of age, Reuben is a charismatic, active, and helpful man. Being a father has been his main reason to tirelessly struggle day by day, looking for alternatives to earn his living and to support his children. Approximately 10 years ago, he started farming. Reuben is hardworking and determined to make it in the world of farming. The land he owns is big enough to support more than just dairy animals. He is planning to make use of the available space to start growing food crops.

Starting a horticultural farm is very costly, especially for small-holder rural farmers. Besides securing land space, a farmer needs to invest in intensive labour, farm tools, and farm inputs. The farmer will also have to construct a store/granary for his/her produce. Reuben is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to venture into horticulture. With your loan investment into his business, Reuben will be having an alternative source of income besides dairy in the near future. This will not only make his family better off but also open new possibilities for him to diversify further in future.

loans.use: to venture into horticulture farming.

loans.name: Kisenyi Kasojo Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of Kisenyi Kasojo, where members guarantee each other. She has 15 children and lives in Fort Portal. She deals in tea farming. She is faced with the challenge of bad weather in the form of heavy rains that destroy her tea. However, she is working very hard to educate her children to higher levels of learning. 

Joyce has asked for a loan to buy fertilizers and drugs to spray her tea plantation. 

One extra member in the photo is still saving, hoping to borrow in the next cycle after the group finishes this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and drugs to spray her tea plantation.

loans.name: Kanyamakerre Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Bena is a member of Kanyamakerre Tukwatanize where members guarantee each other. She has three children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She sells fresh foods like tomatoes, onions, oranges and passion fruits, and does farming to make ends meet. She is faced with the challenges of competition and price changes that hinder the progress of her business. Besides that, she is hoping to expand her business to new areas and diversify her business to include dairy farming. 

Bena has asked for a loan to to add more stock of fresh foods like tomatoes, onions, oranges and passion fruits for resale.

loans.use: to add more stock of fresh foods like tomatoes, onions, oranges and passion fruits for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 39 years old and married with eight children (six go to school). They live in Kasese, Uganda. Emmanuel trades in coffee. He has been in the business since 2012. He also has a motorcycle transport business and a general store, which supplement his income. Emmanuel dreams of expanding his business; however, he is limited by inadequate capital. Emmanuel wants money to buy coffee for selling.

loans.use: to buy coffee for selling.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn runs a small bakery in Kapan town. He lives there with his parents and works hard to run a successful business. In his bakery he mainly makes 'lavash'. This is an Armenian national bread which is in high demand not only in Kapan but overall in Armenia.

Vahagn applied for this loan to invest in his bakery to make it better. He asks lenders to support him. He will use the loan to purchase flour and to build a tandoor for his bakery business development.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Vahagn hopes for support to develop his business and meet customer demands.

loans.use: to pay for flour and build a tandoor.

loans.name: Sussy's Group

texts.en:
Sussy is the group leader of her group from Matete district. She is representing 13 farmers, including herself. She is married and the proud mother of two children. 

Sussy joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for eight years. Like many other farmers, Sussy decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

Sussy's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of six acres of land. They will also receive a total of ten solar lights as, even though Sussy decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Monte Oreb Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario “Monte Oreb”, conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y emprendedoras, con diferentes negocios pero con un solo fin salir adelante, crecer como empresarias. 

La líder del grupo, Emerita  de 46 años, tiene su microempresas de ventas de artículos de ferreterías, desde hace 20 años, ella y su acompañante de vida trabajan juntos en el negocio para así sacar adelante a su hijo. Desea el crédito para cubrir la demanda de los clientes y agrandar su negocio, comprara bujillas, serruchos, martillo y más.  Con las ganancias obtenidas desea construir una habitación más en su casa. 

Las demás integrantes la conforman Arelys de 27 años, esta joven se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de la marca AVON, con el crédito otorgado desea la compra de productos al contado, obteniendo mejores ganancias. Johanna e 30 años tiene su negocio de venta de ropa nueva y productos por catálogo de la marca AVON, comprara granos básicos crear un tercer ingreso y crear asi una pulpería en casa.
texts.en:
The “Monte Oreb” communal bank is made up of three hard-working, determined and enterprising women.  They each have different businesses but the common goals of getting ahead and growing as businesswomen. 

The group's leader, Emerita, is 46-years old.   For the last twenty years, her small business has been selling hardware goods.   She and her husband work together in the business so they can get their son ahead.  Emerita wants the loan to help satisfy her customer's requests and to expand her business.  She will purchase spark plugs, hand-saws, hammers and other items.  With the increased earnings this will provide her, Emerita wants to build another bedroom for her home. 

The other communal bank members are Arelys and Johanna.  Arelys is 27-years old.  This young woman makes her living selling Avon catalog products.  With the loan she has been granted, she wants to make cash purchases for her products, which will earn her  a better income.  Johanna is 30-years old.  Her business is selling new clothing and Avon catalog products.  She will also purchase staple grains, start a third line of income and as such be able to open a small grocery run out of her home.

loans.use: to purchase low-cost spark plugs, hand-saws, hammers and more.

loans.name: Jader Manuel

texts.es:
Jader, junto a su esposa ha podido formar una unidad familiar y productiva bastante fuerte, ya que no solo prima el amor si no también los deseos de salir adelante y progresar como familia.

El se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos y pollos de levante, es una actividad aprendida de su esposo quien actualmente se dedica a esta actividad y ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos durante mucho tiempo.

El pide un auxilio económico para comprar algunos cerdos pequeños e irlos cuidando y criando para posteriormente venderlos.

Es un hombre soñador y con gran voluntad, tanto así que ya piensa en grande y desea tener una marranera con gran capacidad.

Tiene gran ilusión y expectativa con este proyecto y confía en el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para crecer como empresario.
texts.en:
Jader, along with his wife has been able to create quite a strong and productive family unit since, for him, not only does love take priority but also the desire to get by and move forward as a family.

He raises and sells young pigs and chickens. It is work he learned from his spouse who currently does this kind of work and has been the main source of income for a long time. 

He is requesting financial assistance to buy some small pigs and take care of them and raise them to later sell them.

He is a man with dreams and good intentions so much so that he has ambitious plans and wants to have a large capacity pig farm.

He has high hopes and expectations with this project and he trusts in the good hearts of Kiva lenders to be able to grow as a business owner.

loans.use: to buy some small pigs and take care of them and raise them to later sell them.

loans.name: Mabinty Amadu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Mabinty Amadu. She is married and has four children aged 17, 11, 7, and 6 years old, all of whom go to school. In 1998, Mabinty Amadu established her salon business of weavons and other hair attachments.  Working six days a week, 11 hours a day, she earns about 5,562,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Mabinty Amadu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase dozens of assorted hair products like human hair, expression, etc. for resale. In the future, Mabinty Amadu plans to expand her business. With the help of the last loan, she has added another product to her existing business (suitcases). She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of assorted hair products.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is 41 years old and a married mother of eight children, often described as a very trustworthy person. 

Although Martha has been a farmer for 18 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to earn enough to send her children to school. Even though she is new to the program, Martha wanted to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Martha hopes to be able to invest in a business.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of five acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights, as, even though Martha decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Rael's Group

texts.en:
Rael is 65 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing a group formed by 12 farmers from the Matete district, Kenya. 

Rael has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family. Although she described her last harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rael also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Rael's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Peninah's Group

texts.en:
Peninah is a 37-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Peninah has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Peninah described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Peninah’s Group will be able to plant a total of seven acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dalila Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dalila, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo tuvo que viajar a Estados Unidos, en busca de una mejor condición de vida para su familia, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno ya está casado y el segundo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y el ultimo está estudiando.

Dalila, se dedica a vender hot-dog desde hace 2 años y fueron sus familiares que la motivaron a que invirtiera en este negocio, fue así como ella opto por colocar una venta de hot-dog en la escuela de su comunidad.- Antes, solo se dedicaba a los quehaceres del hogar, hoy en día su hijo después de salir de clase le ayuda a vender.

Dalila, necesita el crédito para reparar el carrito donde vende los hot-dog y para comprar más productos para su negocio. 

Su mayor sueño es incrementar las ventas en su negocio, también desea darle la oportunidad a su hijo que siga estudiando, para que pueda graduarse de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Dalila, who is 34 years old, went to school through sixth grade. She is married, and her husband had to travel to the United States in search of better living conditions for his family. She has three children, of whom one is already married, the second works in agriculture, and the last one is in school.

Dalila has been selling hot dogs for two years, and it was her relatives who motivated her to invest in this business. This was how she decided to set up a hot dog stand at the school in her community. Before, she only did the household duties. Now her son helps her to sell after leaving classes.

Dalila needs the loan to repair the little cart where she sells hot dogs and to buy more products for her business.

Her great dream is to increase the sales in her business. She also wants to give her son the opportunity to continue going to school, so that he can graduate from a university program.

loans.use: to repair the little cart where she sells hot dogs and to buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Reuben's Group

texts.en:
Reuben is 45 years old and has six children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very reliable person. Even though Reuben is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by eight farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Reuben started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to get the best-quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has learned a lot from farming training ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Reuben’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a 59-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of seven farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Margaret has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Margaret described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

With this loan, Margaret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Teresa is a 36-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of ten farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Teresa has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Teresa described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Teresa’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan, pictured above, has been a farmer for seven years, and is now proud to represent her group of eight farmers in Matete District. She is 47 years old, is married, and has five children.

Joan likes to think of herself as a very trustworthy person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to save more money. Joan plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Joan’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Margaret, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 50 years old, is married and has four children. Margaret has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Margaret isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Margaret will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Margaret's Group will purchase a total of five solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Corina

texts.en:
Corina, pictured here with her business partner, Jesus, is an artisan from Peru who specializes in 100% alpaca apparel. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool. Corina has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is her story: Corina and Jesus met when they were children and though they lived apart, they kept in touch through the years. "Jesus learned to weave from his mother and grandmother, and in 2012 he suggested we form a society together," recalls Corina. "At first I wasn't sure but we kept talking about it and two months later, I accepted the proposal and this is why I'm in this field now. We've been working on small projects but we're looking for ways to export our designs. Jesus is in charge of weaving and I take care of the administration, but I'm also learning to design sweaters. Jesus and I make a great team — I've learned a lot about the textile arts and I really admire his dedication to this work. We hope to do much more and, with the grace of God, we expect to be able to. We love what we do and are involved in all the details of creating our apparel. Everything you receive from us is made with much love and dedication by two young entrepreneurs who are seeking success. We're giving this project everything we've got." "We'd like to use this loan to purchase wool and start producing apparel in larger quantities so that we can keep up with demand." Use the link below to view Corina's 100% alpaca apparel on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/9019

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool

loans.name: Sukartini

texts.en:
Sukartini is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones, as well as to hire additional artisans for her workshop. Sukartini has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story: "My mother instilled in me the value of a "Balinese woman," including how to prepare temple offerings. I took courses in traditional art of silver." "This microcredit has allowed me to increase my inventory and make new designs. Thank you all the support that you give to me to make my business grow." Use the link below to view Sukartini's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4978

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones, as well as to hire additional artisans for her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a poly tank and store water for her water-vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of sachet drinking water and sell them to her clients

loans.name: Nyesigi Group

texts.fr:
BASSIROU est le monsieur qui tient le bélier par la corne sur la photo. 
BASSIROU est un cultivateur Malien, alphabétisé, âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 7 enfants dont cinq garçons tous scolarisés. Il fait l’embouche ovine depuis plus de 10 ans et sa femme est une ménagère.
BASSIROU s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et revend ses animaux dans les mêmes marchés. Le bénéfice qu’il gagne lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
Il emprunte de l’argent au RMCR pour acheter plus de béliers à engraisser pour revendre. 
BASSIROU rencontre souvent le problème de mévente sur le marché. Son rêve est de devenir un exportateur des bœufs dans l’avenir si possible.
texts.en:
Bassirou is the man holding the ram by the horn in the photo.

Bassirou is a farmer from Mali. He is literate, married, forty-five year old, and a father of seven children, including five boys, who all got to school. He has been fattening goats for over ten years. His wife stays at home.

Bassirou procures his animals in local markets and resells them in the same markets. The profit he earns allows him to meet his family needs.

He is borrowing money from RMCR to purchase more rams to fatten. Bassirou often encounters issues with sales slump on the market. His dream is to become an exporter of cattle in the future if possible.

loans.use: to buy rams to fatten and resell.

loans.name: German

texts.en: German is 21 years old and he is working as a plumbing assistant. Last time German asked for a loan to buy a laptop to use in his education. Recently he was assaulted and the thieves took his computer. Fortunately he is fine, so now German needs the help from Kiva to buy a new computer. German is still living with his parents but they can't help him. German is single and he works and also he is going to college. He hopes you can trust him again. He promises he will be more careful.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Roger Jesus

texts.es:
Roger es un hombre joven de 20 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de contaduría pública. 
Él es inteligente, despierto, atento, alegre, feliz, responsable y buen estudiante. Sus estudios los desarrolla en la universidad pública, caracterizada por encontrarse en el centro de la ciudad, al lado de restaurantes, oficinas, empresas y todo tipo de comercio, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados. 
Roger es de tez morena, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia, estudia inglés como segunda lengua y habla español porque estudia en la universidad. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de contaduría pública y se encuentra en tercer año, sus principales cualidades son; le gustan la matemática y la informática, cuenta con un amplio criterio, es seguro de sí mismo. Se prepara para tomar decisiones razonadas y fundamentadas, con responsabilidad y elevado interés social, “deseo ser un especialista en información financiera y contable; capaz de desempeñarme en diversos campos…” comenta. La ventaja de su carrera es que la demanda de profesionales en esta área es constante, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de materiales de estudio. Su sueño es terminar su carrera y trabajar en una empresa, él desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios sin inconvenientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en su 3 años de estudios en la universidad. 
Es por esos motivos que Roger solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios y terminar su carrera sin inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Roger is 20 years old, single and has no children. He is studying public accounting. He is intelligent, open, attentive, joyful, happy, responsible and a good student.
