He studies in a public university which is located in the center of the city amongst restaurants, offices, companies and all kinds of businesses. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 4 to 16 degrees Celsius.

Roger is dark-skinned with dark eyes, he wears glasses, has short black hair, is short in stature and is thin. His native language is Aymara which he speaks with his family. He takes English as a second language and speaks Spanish to study at the university. He shares his life with his parents who work. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a metal roof that has electricity, running water and sewage.

He is studying Public accounting in his third year. His main qualities are that he likes mathematics and computers, he has good judgement and is sure of himself. He is preparing to take reasoned and founded decisions with responsibility and high social interest. "I want to be a specialist in financial information and accounting, capable of working in various fields", he commented. The advantage of his profession is the constant demand for professionals in this field and the disadvantage is a lack of capital to buy his study materials.

His dream is to finish his studies and work in a company. He wants to make the purchase of a laptop to continue his studies without problems. This is his 2nd loan with the institution in the 3 years he has attended university. For these reasons Roger is requesting a loan to buy a laptop to continue his studies without problems.
.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to continue with his studies, finish his program without problems.

loans.name: Zuvayda

texts.ru: На фотографии изображена 51 летняя жительница аз района Спинамен. Ее зовут Зувайда. Она жена и мать. Зувайда дома не сидит без дела. Она занимается выращиванием крупнорогатых скотин. Зувайда в этой деятельности уже несколько лет. Она хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить поголовья скота. С такими намерениями она обратилась за кредитом. Зувайда уверена, что ее поддержат и помогут. Спасибо.
texts.en: On the photo you can see a 51-year old woman living in the [Spitamen] region. Her name is Zuvayda. She is married and has children. Zuvayda does not remain idle at home. She raises cattle. She has been in this business for several years. She would like to develop her business and increase her headcount. This is why she has applied for a loan. Zuvayda trusts that she will be able to obtain support and help. Thank you.

loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle and increase her headcount.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un joven hombre de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y estudia la carrera de ingeniería en ecología y medio ambiente.
Él es inteligente, atento, alegre, feliz, responsable, trabajador y optimista. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad tecnológica, situada en el centro de la ciudad caracterizada por encontrarse la mayor parte de las oficinas comerciales y públicas. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados.
Juan es de tez morena, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Él estudia en la universidad en tercer año de la carrera de ingeniería ecológica, sus principales cualidades son; goza de interés en el área orientada a la solución de los problemas del área rural, le gusta leer, es de espíritu investigativo e inquieto por los acontecimientos de la comunidad y de la producción agraria sostenible. Él se prepara para ser capaz de planear, evaluar y diseñar sistemas de manejo de residuos y de tratamiento de aguas, de control de la contaminación atmosférica, de ecoeficiencia y tecnologías limpias, de evaluación de impactos ambientales y de aprovechamiento de energías renovables. “siempre me gustó el campo, la naturaleza y quiero poder ayudar de alguna manera a mi planeta…” comenta. La ventaja de su carrera es que la ecología es un tema demandado en este momento, la desventaja es la falta de recursos económicos para terminar sus estudios rápidamente. Su sueño es terminar su carrera profesional para poder trabajar la tierra en el campo ecológico, él desea realizar el pago de su matrícula y sus mensualidades por adelantado para obtener un descuento y terminar sus estudios. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que estudia su carrera profesional.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para pagar la matrícula y sus mensualidades por adelantado para obtener un descuento y terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man of 22 years of age, single, has no children and is studying ecological and environmental engineering.

He is intelligent, attentive, content, happy, responsible, hardworking and optimistic. He studies at the technological university, situated in the centre of the city, which is characterized by being where most of the public and commercial offices are found. Of a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies between 4-16 degrees Celsius during the day.

Juan has a dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, is of medium stature and thin. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks with family and he also speaks Spanish because of the general culture and his studies. He lives with his parents who work. They live in their own house, built from brick and cement with a calamine roof; they have potable water, electricity and sewage.

He is in his third year of ecological engineering and his principal interests are: the area oriented toward finding solutions to rural area problems, reading, he's of an investigative spirit and curious about events in the community and sustainable agrarian production. He is studying to be able to plan, evaluate and design residual management and water treatment systems and atmospheric contamination control systems, eco-efficient and clean technologies, evaluation systems of environmental impact and use of renewable energy. "I always enjoyed the country, nature, and I'd like to be able to help my planet in some way", he comments.

His career choice is advantageous as ecology is a topic in high demand at this time, but what's disadvantageous is his lack of financial recourse to quickly finish his studies. His dream is to finish his professional degree to be able to work in the field of ecology.

He hopes to make his tuition payment and monthly installments, in advance, so he can get a discount and finish his studies. This is his second loan with the institution in the 3 years he's been studying for his degree.

For these reasons, Juan is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition and monthly installments, in advance, so he can get a discount and finish his degree.

loans.use: pay his tuition and monthly installments in advance, so he can receive a discount and finish his university degree.

loans.name: Perlas Doradas Fc Group

texts.es:
¨Perlas Doradas FC¨, el grupo solidario y mixto, conformados por 1 hombre y 3 mujeres jóvenes, todos ellos emprendedores. Originarios de la zona rural de Masaya. Solicitan su primer crédito a ADIM. Comprometiéndose ser un grupo responsables con sus pagos. 

La coordinadora del grupo, Lizeth de 25 años, casada y con 4 hijos menores de edad. Es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, con el dinero entregado invertirá en la compra de granadilla, chilote, naranja y limón. Los otras integrantes son Gonzalo de 41 años se dedica a la compra de cosechas como aguacate, tamarindo  y mango; Claudia de 19 años se dedica a la venta de compra y venta de frutas granadilla, sandia y melón; Ruth de 22 años comercializa la compra y venta de ropa  nueva para adultos.
texts.en:
"Perlas Doradas" ("Golden Pearls") is a mixed loan group, consisting of one man and three young women, all of them entrepreneurs. They are natives of the rural zone of Masaya. They are applying to ADIM for their first loan and promise to be a responsible group with their payments.

The coordinator of the group, Lizbeth, is 25 years old. She is married and has four minor children. She is a businesswoman and sells fruits and vegetables. With the money she receives, she will invest in the purchase of passion fruit, corn, oranges, and lemons. The other members are Gonzalo, who is 41 and works in the purchase of crops such as avocados, tamarinds, and mangoes. Claudia, who is 19, buys and sell fruits such as passion fruits, watermelons, and melons. Ruth, who is 22, buys and sells new clothing for adults.

loans.use: to buy passion fruit, corn, oranges, and lemons

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleonora has always loved helping people, and three years ago, she decided to start her own home care business. She has been an independent business owner for two years, providing non-medical care for elderly and homebound adults and allowing them to continue to live at home in as independent a manner as possible. She occasionally receives assistance from two of her daughters.

Ethnically Turkish, Eleonora is from Russia and moved to the United States over ten years ago. She currently lives with her husband and three daughters. The best part of her business, she claims, “is meeting sweet, joyful, and wonderful people.” However, her greatest business struggle has been obtaining more clients. With this loan, she will pay for home care training classes to improve her home care business and obtain more clients.

Eleonora wants “to wake up every morning feeling good about myself and the people my business will be helping.” In the future, she hopes to maintain a highly successful business that her daughters can continue to run. 

Check out her website at www.rockyhillhomecare.net.

loans.use: to pay for home care training classes to improve her home care business and obtain more clients

loans.name: Phoebe's Group

texts.en:
Phoebe, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Matete District. She is 50 years old, is married, and has six children.

Phoebe likes to think of herself as a very reliable person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Phoebe plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Phoebe’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate six acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Shakila's Group

texts.en:
Shakila, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has two children.

With a portion of this loan, Shakila will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. Shakila plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Shakila’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Joseph.  He is married and has one child who is a 15-month-old baby. He has two additional dependents who live with him to be fostered.  In 2000, Joseph established his clothing business of shirts, crepe, lacoste, polo, belts, slippers, etc. He began his business because he could not afford his college fees. He decided to do petty trade, then he was later assisted with some amount of money by a distant relative. He invested wisely and has made good improvement in his business.  Working six days a week, 11 hours a day, he earns about 10,424,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Joseph requires a loan in order to purchase additional dozens of shirts, crepe, lacoste belt, etc. In the future, Joseph plans to build a house and educate his children. His major challenge is inadequate capital.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional dozens of shirts, crepe, lacoste belt etc.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy is 38 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has two children and is married. As a group leader, Nancy is representing her group of 14 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Nancy's desire to make more farmer friends in her community. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

Nancy and her group will receive a total of 9 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Bety's Group

texts.en:
Bety, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than thirty years, and is now proud to represent her group of ten farmers in Matete District. She is 52 years old, is married, and has nine children.

Bety likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to save more money. Bety plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Bety’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Anthony's Group

texts.en:
In the photo is Anthony, often described as an extremely reliable person. He is 34 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 10 farmers from the Matete district, Kenya. He is married and has three children.

Anthony is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again. This means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Anthony says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2014, he has been able to save more money, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Anthony will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Paul is a 55-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 11 farmers from the Matete district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Paul has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Paul described his harvest as excellent last year but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing a solar light in addition to fertilizer and maize because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Paul’s Group will be able to plant a total of seven acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac, pictured above, has nine children and is always described as a very trustworthy person, which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group. Isaac is representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Isaac has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Isaac is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 6.5 acres will be planted by Isaac's Group, and between them they will receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Maliti Ti-Pusuga Group

texts.en:
Samata is a 47-year-old woman from Pusuga in the northern region of Ghana. She is married and has five children. Samata is the individual pictured with the hand raised among members sitting.

Samata is a member of a shea nuts processing group that has been in business for the last seven years. The name of the group is ‘Maliti ti-pusuga’. Samata earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea nuts processing business such that they can always produce premium quality shea crude butter for the local markets and for the export markets.

Samata and ‘Maliti ti-pusuga’ have asked for a loan of GHS 6,900. Samata’s share of the loan is GHS 600 which she would use to buy shea nuts and process shea crude butter. She has planned to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family's health and children's educational needs.

Samata thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts and process shea crude butter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of locally made cheese for resale.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 59-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of seven farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Mary has noticed that she has a larger farm group support.

Mary described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of four acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Johanna is a 59-year-old jovial and energetic woman who has overcome the loss of her husband to take on the challenge of starting a business.

She worked as a domestic worker but left when her husband passed away, citing that she had lost the energy to carry on working. She has bounced back since, and is now looking to a new and positive chapter of her life. 

Johanna has always loved hosting visitors and welcoming people to her home. It is her hospitality that has motivated her to start a business selling 'home-cooked' food within her community. Indeed Johanna has already engaged the local police station as well as the church and has been permitted to display and distribute food in these two locations. 

She is thus requesting  a loan to buy a mobile stove as well as a gas anvil. This equipment, she says, will be a big boost to her business and will set her off on a fulfilling journey.

She hopes to inspire all women within her community by her resilience and will to not only survive but grow.

loans.use: to buy a mobile six-burner stove and a gas anvil

loans.name: Dios Proveera 4 Group

texts.en:
Persia is a member of the group called Dios Proveera (God Will Provide) 4. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane industry and is compounded by Haitian inmigrants living in this Batey. 

She is excited to be taking her twelfth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanding her business. 

Persia plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cosmetics and other beauty products like deodorant, hand and body lotion, perfume, etc. With this loan she will increase her business inventory. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and help her long-term partner with their family expenses. 

She is a mother of three children, and she lives together with her and her long-term partner, also her children's father. She dreams of having a successful business to provide enough support for her family's needs. Persia thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products like cosmetics, beauty products, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy plantains, cooking oil, chicken, and other goods

loans.name: Maceo

texts.en:
One day when Maceo was working as a teamster, he realized that the amount of money he made in a year was the same amount that one of his customers spent in a month. The realization made him decide to take a risk: start his own company and build a more profitable future for himself. He started his own cleaning company providing services for commercial venues, offices, and the hospitality sector.

Maceo comes from a family of self-made men. Two of his uncles owned a shipping company and an import/export business in the Bahamas. Another uncle was Prime Minister of Security in the Bahamas. With these influences, Maceo has been driven to create his own economically sustainable and stable future. He has already experienced great successes. Several large banks and companies in New York City rely on him for services, and he has won Project Enterprise’s Entrepreneur of the Year. He has experienced a sudden boom in demand for his services and now must work to hire more employees and expand the capacities of his company.

This loan will allow Maceo to pay for uniforms, operating expenses, and payroll for his cleaning company. He plans to hire 27 more employees in the coming months and augment advertising efforts to obtain more clients. 

Check out his website at www.cleaan.com

loans.use: to pay for uniforms, operating expenses, and payroll for his cleaning company

loans.name: Dios Es Esperanza 2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the group coordinator for Dios es la Esperanza (God is the Hope) 2 Group. This group is located in the city of El Seibo. In her home by herself, she is a single young woman. She enjoy sharing with her family, especially her parents. The other members run different businesses, selling miscellaneous products such as clothes and food. 

This is Francisca's eighth loan. She runs a food stall from her home where she sells fried food like fried dough filled with meat, fried chicken, and plantains. She would like to continue expanding her business by increasing her inventory to attract more customers and to cook more plates. 

Francisca says she enjoys doing business, and her most important dream is to have a successful business. She started the business with her first Esperanza loan almost four years ago, and she has reinvested and increased her sales over time. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy meat, chicken, plantains, flour, etc.

loans.name: Osman Toes

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Osman Toes.  He is married and has five children aged 12, 8, 5, 3 and 1 year old, two of whom are are school-going children. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to be fostered.  In 2001, Osman Toes established his clothing business of jean trousers, shirts, polo, lacoste etc. He began his business because his parents were traders, and being a male child, it is his responsibility to be involved in the running of the family business.  Education was not considered. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 5,308,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Osman Toes requires a loan in order to buy additional dozens of lacoste and crepe caps. In the future, Osman Toes plans to reinvest and expand the business and educate his children. His major challenged is delay in payment from some customers.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional dozens of lacoste, crepe caps.

loans.name: Kadiatu Rackson

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Kadiatu Rackson.  She is married and has three children aged 31, 27, and 24 years old. She has 3 additional dependents who live with her to be fostered.  In 2011, Kadiatu Rackson established her provisions and drinks business.  Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 2,626,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu Rackson has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase crates of soft drinks and cartons of provisions. In the future, Kadiatu Rackson plans to purchase a larger refrigerator to store soft drinks and other beverages. She did not acquire much for the shop as previously planned, but she started another venture (soft drinks and beverages).  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase crates of soft drinks and cartons of provisions.

loans.name: Abner Isai

texts.es:
Abner, de 27 años de edad, solo estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y tienen una hija.

Abner, se dedica a la agricultura, esta actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años y fue por medio de su papá que él aprendió a trabajar en el campo, él recorre 2 kilómetros para llegar a donde realiza su trabajo, además trabaja como ayudante en un camión de carga.
  
Abner, solicita el crédito exactamente para instalar la energía eléctrica en su vivienda, ya que por el momento no cuenta con este servicio. 

Su mayor sueño, es tener una mejor condición de vida para su familia y además culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Abner, who is 27 years old, only studied through the first year of high school. He is in a relationship, and his partner takes care of the household chores. They have one daughter.

Abner works in agriculture. He has been in this line of work for many years. He learned to work in the fields from his dad. He walks two kilometers to arrive at the place where he works. He also works as a helper on a cargo truck.

Abner is requesting a loan for the exact purpose of installing electrical power in his house, because at the moment he does not have this service. 

His greatest dream is to have better living conditions for his family, and also to finish school.

loans.use: to install electricity in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more palm oil and bags of garrie (cassava flakes) for her shop

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DRAMANE  est le monsieur qui  tient la corne du bélier sur la photo.
DRAMANE  est  un  malien  non scolarisé âgé de 43 ans, marié et  Père de 04 enfants, âgés de 2   à  25 ans dont 1 est scolarisé. Sa femme est une ménagère.
 Il  fait  l’élevage ovine, Il prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour acheter  beaucoup  de béliers. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend  dans ses mêmes foires.  Il  a une expérience de 07 ans  d’élevage.
 Dans ses ventes, il gagne en moyenne  15000 FCFA de profit par Béliers. Avec le profit,  DRAMANE pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (habillement, santé et frais de scolarité).  Il est souvent confronté à certaines difficultés (mort ou perte de béliers) et  a des situations de mévente mais s’est organisé à avoir  des acheteurs potentiels qui lui facilite l’écoulement de ses béliers.  
Dans l’avenir  Dramane  veut  un prêt beaucoup plus  élevé pour augmenter son  activité  d’élevage pour gagner plus de profit afin de s’acheter un tracteur et aussi faire un jardin potager  pour sa  famille.
texts.en:
Dramane is the man holding the ram’s horn in the photo. He is a 43-year-old Malian who did not go to school. He is married and a father of four children aged 2 to 25, one of which goes to school. His wife stays at home.

He raises goats. He is taking a loan with RMCR to purchase many rams. He purchases from local fairs and resells at the same fairs. He has seven years of experience raising goats.

In his sales, he earns on average 15,000 XOF by ram. With the profit, Dramane will be able to provide for his family (clothing, healthcare, and school fees). He often faces some difficulties (death or loss of rams) and has encountered sales issues but he got organized with potential clients who make it easier for him to resell his rams.

In the future, Dramane would like a much higher loan to grow his farming business, make greater profits, purchase a tractor, and create a vegetable garden for his family.

loans.use: to buy rams to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Paul is 47 years old and has five children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by ten farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Paul has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Paul also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Paul's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Las Tres Estrellas De Chuabaj Group

texts.es:
Zoila es una joven de 23 años de edad, responsable y trabajadora que vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Zoila  (es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa ella se dedica  a la elaboración de ropa típica, esta labor lo realiza ella desde  hace 5 años, ella eligió esta actividad porque es muy rentable para ella y su familia.
Zoila gracias a la dedicación y esmero con el que elabora sus tejidos típicos, tiene mucha demanda, pero ahora se ha dado cuenta que necesita modernizar más sus tejidos porque el mundo de la moda ahora se encuentra en constantes cambios, por tal razón se ha unido a un grupo de personas para solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá comprando hilos, de tipo  seda, alemán,  lustrina y mish.
Zoila y su grupo guardan las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder invertirlo en su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y que algún día cuenten con un local donde puedan exhibir mejorar sus productos.
texts.en:
Zoila is a young woman of 23, responsible and hard-working, who lives with her parents in a community of Chichicastenango. Zoila (she is the first one on the left side of the photograph), with the goal of obtaining income and helping her parents with the household expenses, makes traditional clothing. She has done this work for five years. She chose this work because it is very profitable for her and her family.

Zoila, thanks to the dedication and care with which she makes her traditional fabrics, has a lot of demand, but now she has realized that she needs to modernize her fabrics more because the world of fashion is now in constant change. For this reason she has formed a group of people to apply for a loan that she will invest in buying silk, German, cotton, and Mish embroidery threads.

Zoila and her group have hopes of obtaining a loan in order to be able to invest it in their businesses to improve their income and of someday having a shop where they can exhibit their products better.

loans.use: to buy silk, German, cotton, and Mish embroidery threads

loans.name: Sabali Ye Sigidia Group

texts.fr:
AROUNA est celui qui tient le bœuf  par sa corne  sur la photo 
AROUNA  est un cultivateur Malien, âgé de 40 ans marié, sa femme est une ménagère,  père de 4 enfants tous scolarisés dont 3 garçons âgés de 16 à 7 ans.
Il est alphabétisé, et exerce l’activité d’embouche bovine il y a très longtemps. Il s’approvisionne sur les marchés locaux et revend  dans les mêmes marchés. Le bénéfice qu’il gagne lui permet de faire face aux charges de sa famille.
AROUNA fait recourt au RMCR pour acheter de bœufs, il l’attache pour l’engraiser puis il le revend par la ssuite.
Ayant appris l’embouche bovine à l’enfance, il a l’amour de cette activité ; il se voit de participer au développement économique de sa communauté.
AROUNA est souvent confronté au problème de perte  imprévisible de ses bœufs et souhaite devenir un grand exportateur dans les jours à venir.
texts.en:
Arouna is the man holding the ox by the horn in the photo. He is a 40-year-old married Malian. He went to school, and is a father of four school-going children, including three boys aged 7 to 16. His wife stays at home.

Arouna has been raising cattle for a very long time. He purchases from local markets and resells at the same markets. The profits he earns allow him to provide for his family.

Arouna is turning to RMCR to purchase cattle; he purchases animals to fatten and then resell. He learned how to farm cattle as a child and loves this activities; he sees himself participating in the economic development of his community.

Arouna often faces unforeseen losses with his cattle. In the coming years, he wishes to become a major exporter.

loans.use: to buy cattle to to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Maranatha De Samarie 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Rosena est le coordinatrice de son groupe Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 4. Elle est marié, elle a 2 enfants. Elle habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitée. Elle dirige son commerce d' articles divers (avec chaussures, vetement, cosmetiques, etc.) pendants  les 15 dernières années. Rosena espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. 

Des autres membres Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 4 ont besoin d'un emprunt pour le commerce tel que: ventes produits alimentaires, boissons gazeuses, chaussures, vetement, etc. Elle déclare que son défi principal est de venir un grand commerçant dans le département du nord. Elle dit son but principal c'est d'avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Rosena is the coordinator of her group, Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 4. She is married with two children. She lives in the North-Eastern region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and drinkable water very limited. She has been running a general retail business for the past fifteen years (selling shoes, clothing, cosmetics, etc.). Rosena hopes that this loan will help her grow her business.

Other members of Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 4 need loan for retail businesses such as food retail, carbonated beverages, shoes, clothing, etc.

Rosena states that her main challenge is to become a major retailer in the Northern region. She says that her main goal is to have a large business which will help her build a big house with help from Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to buy various products, incl. shoes.

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Johana es una humilde mujer de 43 años, que se dedica a la venta de comida “fritanga”. Ella ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio diversificando el servicio de venta de comida que le ofrece a sus clientes, de esta manera ha logrado aumentar sus ganancias y satisfacer la demanda.
Ahora ella solicita un crédito para comprar carne de res, pollo, aceite y  arroz de esta manera hacer en mayor cantidad sus comidas para así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Además podrá obtener mejores ganancias e iniciar la construcción de su vivienda para no alquilar en otro lugar. Su apoyo es su esposo y sus planes son ahorrar para un futuro próspero y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Johana is a humble woman of 43 whose work is selling "fritanga" [typical Nicaraguan foods]. She has managed to get ahead in her business by diversifying the food-selling service that she offers to her customers. In this way she has succeeded in increasing her earnings and satisfying demand.

Now she is applying for a loan to buy beef, chicken, oil, and rice so that in this way she can make greater quantities of her foods in order to thus satisfy the needs of her customers. In addition, she will be able to obtain better earnings and begin the construction of her house so that she doesn't have to rent another place. Her support is her husband, and their plans are to save for a prosperous future and to help their family.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products including rice, vegetable oil, sugar, soap, salt, candles, cookies, candies, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 42 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. Helen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns income from pig fattening.

Helen has borrowed and repaid three loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan.  She has requested a 9,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Helen hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: La Manzana Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario, ¨La Manzana¨, por primera vez  solicita crédito a ADIM, para comenzar a desarrollar sus negocios, del cual se sustenta desde hace varios años.  La coordinadora del grupo es María Cristina de 34 años, soltera, con 1 hijo de 11 años, orgullosa por sacar adelante a su hijo, se dedica al área de belleza a domicilio, con el crédito comprara materiales como una plancha para el cabello y material para acrílico, y más. 
Las demás integrantes son Fátima de 33 años dedicada a la venta de ropa, cosmético y bisutería y José Antonio tiene una pulpería en el hogar y requiere del préstamo para comprar una vitrina y mercadería (gaseosas y jugos)
texts.en:
The loan group "La Manzana" is applying to ADIM for a loan for the first time in order to begin to develop their businesses, from which they have supported themselves for a number of years.

The coordinator of the group is Maria Cristina, who is 34 years old and single, with an 11-year-old son. She is proud to be raising her son. She works in home beauty services. With the loan, she will buy materials such as an iron for hair, materials for acrylic [nails], and other items.

The other members are Fátima, who sells clothing, cosmetics, and jewelry, and José Antonio, who has a grocery store in his house and needs the loan to buy a display case and merchandise (soft drinks and juices).

loans.use: to buy materials such as an iron for hair, materials for acrylic nails, and other items.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

Josephine has requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell. In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has an ice candy business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy business.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Brenda is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Brenda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Brenda requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business.

Brenda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Brenda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old and married, with one child.

Adelaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Adelaida has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Adelaida aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 45 years old and has eleven children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Corazon is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 3 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her pigs.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 22 years old, married, and has two children. 

Leonor is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonor requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Leonor has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 3 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Leonor would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her pigs.

Maricel has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 3 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her pigs.

loans.name: Fahad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Fahad. Fahad lives in Pekalongan, a city located in Central Java, about 2 hours from Jakarta by plane. Fahad owns a stall that sells consumer products and provides mobile payment services for his community on a daily basis.

He has already been with Ruma for almost a year. He learned of Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join because he wanted to learn more about how to improve his business using technology.

His community sees him as a friendly person, that’s why it’s so easy for himFahad to attract customers.
 
As the business grows, Fahad is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Knowing of these important goals demonstrates that your loan will be very useful to help Fahad improve his business and, accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services.

Fahad’s goal with Ruma for the near future is to offer an e-commerce service for his community. As seen in the photo, Fahad is the one standing in his stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc.) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Yani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Yani.

Yani lives in Lumajang, located in East Java, approximately four hours from Surabaya, the capital city of East Java, Indonesia.

Yani owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to members of his community. He decided to join Ruma because he had heard that Ruma has the best service and systems. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, Yani needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Yani’s goal with Ruma for the near future is to offer an e-commerce business for his community: Ruma’s latest product called Mapan.

As seen in the photo, Yani is the one who standing in his stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal, a fisherman and also a farmer for over 25 years, lives in Koh Tamov Village with his wife and six children. Five of his children have started working as farmers, which gives him a big hand for his farming business. As a farmer and also a fisherman, he has to get up early and come back home late and sometime he fishes during the night to earn extra money for his family. However, early morning in an area that is off the power grid is dark and insecure. His current energy solution (a car battery) is not reliable and easily damaged. Therefore, Sophal decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system to sustain his family business and for his one last child to have a good educational environment at night. After using solar home systems, he can reduce time and money on energy and also give a better educational condition to his last child who wants to pursue higher education.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Koh Tamov Village, Kampong Preahkorki Commune, Bor

loans.name: Sedana Ayu Group

texts.en:
The Sedana Ayu group feels excited. Their business in pig breeding earned maximum results. The price for pork now is quite high and it was a good time to sell all the pigs. All the members earned a satisfactory profit. 

Ni Nengah sold all of her pigs. She earned a satisfactory profit. Ni Nengah can also produce more chips. Now she can fullfill her daily needs from this effort. 

The Sedana Ayu group is continuing to borrower loans.  The loan and the pig breeder program from MUK have proven that they can improve their lives. They can have a loan without collateral and receive training for better knowledge of the pig business.

Ni Nengah used her loans to purchase superior piglets for fattening and to buy bananas and cassava to make chips. She hopes her piglets can grow faster. She plans to save all the profit for business capital.

loans.use: to buy superior quality piglets and to buy bananas and cassava to make chips

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Connie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from fish vending. Connie is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Connie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Horn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village, there is not reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en:
Ma. Aida is 44 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Aida has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ma. Aida has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Aida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Candelaria Ethelvina

texts.es:
Doña Candelaria es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella tiene 31 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 4 y 7 años de edad, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Doña Candelaria con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la venta salpor molido  que se utiliza para elaborar la comida tradicional de su pueblo, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 3 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  a la elaboración de ropa típica  agracias a estas dos  actividades ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Doña Candelaria ahora se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un prestamo porque ya llego la época de lluvia y con ello la temporada de cultivo de maíz, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder pagar el alquiler del terreno donde va a sembrar y comprar sus fertilizantes, ella solicita la cantidad de Q. 2000.00 para abastecer esta necesidad.
Doña candelaria tiene las esperanzas puestas en este préstamo, porque solo así podrá sembrar en este año y podrá obtener sus alimentos para el próximo año. Ella sueño con poder comprar un terreno para poder cultivar su maíz y no pagar alquiler.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a very hardworking woman. She is 31 years old, is married and has a beautiful family of three children in between the ages of four and seven years old. The beautiful family lives in a community in San Andrés Semetabaj. 

Eager to improve her income and support her husband with the household expenses, Candelaria makes a living selling “salpor” flour, which is used to prepare the traditional food of her people. She has done this work for three years, but in order to boost her profits she also makes traditional clothing. Thanks to these two activities, she has managed to provide for her family. 

Candelaria now sees why asking for a loan is necessary – because the rainy season has already arrived and with it the season for corn crops. But, one of the difficulties that she has is that she does not have enough money to pay rent on the land where she’ll plant nor to buy fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 quetzales in order to meet the need. 

Candelaria has hopes for this loan because she will only sow the land this year and will be able to harvest the crops for the next year. She dreams of being able to buy land in order to cultivate her corn and not pay rent.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rent land.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and married with nine children. Seven of her children are sent to school.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Maria has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Maria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rossini

texts.en:
Rossini is 24 years old and married with two children. 

Rossini is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rossini requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rossini has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rossini would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Barchynai

texts.ru: Барчынай, 23 года, не замужем, детей нет. У Барчынай среднее образование, она целеустремленна, жизнерадостна и трудолюбива. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, родители помогают по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Барчынай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 6 овец. Для содержания скота имеются все условия. Также Барчынай на земельной доле мерою 0,55 Га выращивает клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Барчынай обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Барчынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на постройку дополнительных сараев для скота.
texts.en: Barchynai is 23 years old, not married and does not have children. Barchynai has a secondary education, is driven, happy and hardworking. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 5 years. Her parents help her with the business. Thanks to Barchynai's hard work, today her farm has 6 cows and 6 sheep. She has all of the necessary conditions for keeping livestock. Barchynai also grows clover for sale on 0.55 hectares of land.Her monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Barchynai requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a cow in order to increase her livestock headcount. Barchynai plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities and wants to save money to build additional barns for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Peou's Group

texts.en:
Peou’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Peou makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. 

In their village, there is not reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 28 years old, married and has two children. One of her children is in school.

Salvacion is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Salvacion has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a hardworking female entrepreneur with five children. She has a business selling fruit in the Philippines, and industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as fattening pigs and a general store. 

Ma. Fe has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruit to sell. She dreams that one day, she will be able to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 54 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are sent to school.

Cecelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Cecelia has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Cecelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 49 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Bella works very hard to provide for them.

Bella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Bella has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Bella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Libertina

texts.en:
Libertina previously accessed an Rp 20,000,000 loan to purchase green technology products to sell in her community. She successfully paid this fourth loan off over six months.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting another Rp 10,000,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more stock of green technology products and provide solutions to her customers’ problems: difficult access to clean water, unaffordable LPG gas, which makes them choose between a three stone fire or kerosene stove, and the lack of access to electricity.
 
Libertina is grateful for the support to increase her earnings and buy building materials to complete construction of a house for her family.

loans.use: to help introduce simple, clean energy products to her community

loans.name: Phina's Group

texts.en:
Phina’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Phina makes a living by cultivating rice. She also does extra work as tailor to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter and provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kern's Group

texts.en:
Kern’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province, Cambodia. Kern makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families while saving money on medical expenses and saving time on collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter and provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bunthoenn's Group

texts.en:
Bunthoenn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Bunthoenn works as farmer to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families while saving money on medical expenses and saving time on collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter and provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter and provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mertha Sedana Group

texts.en:
The Mertha Sedana group made their payment. The payment was represented by the board of the group because most of the members work in the rice field. The group has repaid all the loans well and they decided to borrow a new loan. Although the results were not so significant, this business already supports all their needs, they can save and they can renovate their house or kitchen. They are really thankful to the lenders, MUK and Kiva.

Ni Ketut sold all her piglets. After deducting all the costs, she earned a profit. Compared to her prior profit, she lost 500,000 IDR. But she still feels grateful. Now she can save for business capital.

To increase the business, the Mertha Sedana group is continuing their loan. With this loan, it was decided by all the members to purchase superior piglets only. They choose this option in order to have the same pig price, and a better profit, and they can sell them later together to a big buyer.

Ni Ketut purchased three superior piglets and bought some merchandise for her kiosk.  To reduce the cost, she combined the superior feed with a traditional feed. Ni Ketut and her husband are really grateful for the loans they received. Every day she spends 15,000 for daily needs and 100,000 per month for electricity and water.

Two members are not in the picture because of a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets and buy some merchandise for her kiosk

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is thankful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan to buy dozens of fresh chickens to buy wholesale and to sell retail. Through her earnings she is able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for an 11,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for her "padala" encashment business (small remittance center where cellular subscribers can send money by loading it on their cellular phone numbers for a certain fee). Part of the loan she will use to purchase fresh chicken to sell. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it is a great help to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her child.

Rosita dreams of having a decent and bigger stall to sell chicken. She prays that her business and that their quality of life will improve.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for dozens of fresh chickens to sell.

loans.name: Arzykan

texts.ru: Арзыкан, 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Арзыкан- средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 25 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. На сегодня у нее развитое фермерское хозяйство. Благодаря упорному труду Арзыкан, на сегодняшний день имеется: 30 овец, 4 коровы, 4 лошади. На 2,2 Га арендованной и 1,8 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль, клевер, пшеницу и перец для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Арзыкан решила построить большой дом для своей семьи, однако ей не хватает средств для завершения строительства, она не хотела бы продавать скот, поэтому обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) для закупки гипсокартона для утепления, краски, шпаклевки. Доходы от бизнес деятельности Арзыкан планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и завершение строительства дома.
texts.en: Arzykan is 46 years old, married and, together with her husband, raising 4 children. Arzykan has a specialized secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 25 years. Today she has well-developed farming business. Thanks to Arzykan's hard work, today she has 30 sheep, 4 cows and 4 horses. She grows beans, clover, wheat and peppers on 2.2 hectares of leased and 1.8 own land for the household consumption and sale. Arzykan decided to build a big house for her family, but does not have enough money to complete the construction. She would prefer not to sell livestock and this is why she requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy drywall for insulation, paint and putty. Arzykan plans to invest the earnings from the business into increasing her livestock headcount and fishing the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy drywall for insulation, paint and putty in order to finish building her house

loans.name: Dakoupa Pade Group

texts.fr: Bintou, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait le commerce des pagnes et de la friperie et elle a besoin de ce prêt pour s'approvisionner. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans maintenant. Cette brave dame est très accueillante et c'est ce qui lui permet de maintenir sa clientèle et d'attirer d'autres. Avec ce prêt, elle pourra acheter plus de pagnes et la friperie pour vendre. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de s'occuper de ses enfants(soigner, acheter des habits, des chaussures etc...) et de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Bintou is the group representative.  She is married and has four children.  Bintou sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and second hand clothing and needs this loan to restock her supplies.

Bintou has been running her business for three years and is very welcoming.  This helps her keep her customers and attract new ones.

The earnings she will make from selling her clothing will enable her to take care of her children and provide clothes, shoes and healthcare for them.  They will also help to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: 5 De Junio Group

texts.es:
Marisol es una mujer de 65 años, casada, tiene 4 hijos adultos e independientes, y su negocio es la decoración de fiestas.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, comprensiva, divertida, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’  donde el comercio ha prosperado en los últimos años, antiguamente, el comercio se reducía a bares, quioscos  y farmacias; pero ahora incluye bancos, institutos, paradas de taxis, baños públicos, tiendas, ferreterías, y otros. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Marisol es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello gris largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera) su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada, la primera de la derecha, viste manta celeste). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como electricista, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus ganas de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocio como; venta de chompas de lana, venta de empanadas, venta de aceite a granel, venta de accesorios para celular, venta de desayunos, venta de poleras para niño y venta de sombreros, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la decoración de fiestas; ella se encarga de decorar todo tipo de ambientes para la realización de fiestas, bautizos, bodas, cumpleaños infantiles, toma de  mano, etc., actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana, trabajando y recibiendo los pedidos en su tienda fija durante el día, las decoraciones generalmente las realiza los fines de semana, “Cada detalle cuenta en la decoración de una fiesta, desde las flores que elijamos para decorarla hasta las servilletas que acompañan la vajilla…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las reservas se realizan durante el día para ejecutarlas el fin de semana, la desventaja es que los fines de semana deben cerrar su tienda para ocuparse de la decoración. Su sueño es ampliar su tienda y abrirla también los fines de semana, ella desea realizar la compra de un horno de 6 latas para la elaboración de tortas de matrimonio y masitas para cumpleaños infantiles y bautizos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Marisol solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno de 6 latas para hornear tortas de matrimonio y masitas infantiles para mejorar su actividad
texts.en:
Marisol is a 65-year-old mother who has 4 independent, adult children. She has a party decoration business. She is a good mother who is independent, perseverant, understanding, funny, responsible, and very hard-working. She carries out her business in the area of 'Cruce Villa Adela', where business has flourished in the past few years.  In the past, commerce there was reduced to bars, kiosks, and pharmacies, but now it includes banks, schools, taxi stands, public bathrooms, shops, and hardware stores, among other things.  The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day from 0 to 12°C.  Marisol has a dark complexion, long grey hair that wears in braids, and brownish-grey eyes, with an average build and short stature.  She wears traditional clothing (hat, cloak, and skirt) and her maternal tongue is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish with the general public and when doing business. In the photo, she is seated farthest to the right wearing a blue cloak.

She shares her life with her husband who works as an electrician, and they live in their own home made of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof that has potable water, electricity, and plumbing.  Her desire to improve led her to form a credit group so that the members could take out a loan and improve their businesses.  They sell things such as as wool sweaters, empanadas, oil in bulk, cellphone accessories, breakfast, and children's skirts and hats.  She has a party decoration business.  She is in charge of decorating all kinds of environments for parties, christenings, weddings, children's birthday parties,  and engagement parties, among others, and she does this work every day of the week, working and receiving orders fom her fixed store during the day.   She generally does the decorating on the weekends.  She notes that every detail counts in party decoration, from the flowers that she chooses to decorate with up to the napkins that accompany the dishes.  The advantage of her business is that she takes reservations during the day in order to fulfill them on the weekends, and the disadvantage is that she has to close her store on the weekends to take care of the decorating.  

Her dream is to expand her store and keep it open even on the weekends.  She is requesting a loan to buy a 6-tray oven to make wedding cakes and cookies for children's birthdays and christenings to improve her business.  This is her first cycle of loans with the institution in the year that she has been doing this business.

loans.use: to buy a 6-tray oven to bake wedding cakes a cookies for children's parties

loans.name: La Souriante Group

texts.fr: Papiye est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédit «La Souriante», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 39 ans, femme vivant seule, mère de 3 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son grand frère. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés dans le marché central de la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 960 poissons salés. Elle souhaite construire une maison, augmenter ses activités, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Papiye is a retailer and member of the loan group 'La Souriante', which works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 39 years old, single and has three children who all attend school.  She began her business with money she received from her elder brother.

Papiye has been selling salted fish in the main market in town for seven years.  This loan will enable her to buy 960 salted fish.

In the future, Papiye would like to be able to build a house, expand her business, educate and feed her children.  She is very grateful to Hekima for the support they provide to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 960 salted fish for resale.

loans.name: Zhyparkul

texts.ru: Жыпаркул, 50 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. Образование у нее среднее. По характеру очень жизнерадостная, ответственная и целеустремленная  женщина. В течении уже 20 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть корова и 14 овец. На участке мерою 3,60 Га она выращивает экологически чистую фасоль. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и селитры для подготовки почвы к весенне-полевым работам. На прибыль от кредита Жыпаркул и дальше развивать свое дело.
texts.en: Zhyparkul is 50 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a secondary education. She is happy, responsible and driven woman by nature. She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 20 years. Her farm contains a cow and 14 sheep. She grows ecologically clean beans on 3.60 hectares of land. To continue developing her business, Zhyparkul requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers and saltpeter to cultivate the soil for the spring field work. Zhyparkul will use the profit from the loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and saltpeter to cultivate the soil for the spring field work in order to grow organic beans

loans.name: Tranquillité Group

texts.fr: Wabenga est commerçante, présidente du groupe  de crédit «Tranquillité», client de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère 6 enfants dont 5 étudient et 1 est gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés au marché du centre ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle va acheter de 10 ballons de souliers. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Wabenga is a retailer and president of the loan group 'Tranquillité', which works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 39 years old, married and has six children, five of whom attend school, one is still too young.  She began her business with money she received from her husband.

Wabenga has been selling second hand shoes in the main market in town since she was very young.  This loan will enable her to buy ten lots of second hand shoes.

In the future, Wabenga would like to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.  She is very grateful to Hekima for the support they provide to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 10 lots of second hand shoes for resale.

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Kalendi est commerçante, trésorière du groupe solidaire «La Gloire de Dieu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 45 ans, mère 3 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires à sons domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 9 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en huile de palmes. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kalendi is a retailer and treasurer of the loan group 'La Gloire de Dieu', which works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 45 years old and has three children who all attend school.  She began her business with money she received from her husband.

Kalendi has been selling basic foodstuffs from her home on a busy avenue in town for nine years.  This loan will enable her to buy palm oil.

In the future, Kalendi would like to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.  She is very grateful to Hekima for the support they provide to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Elonga A Group

texts.fr: Sikuliwako est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédit «Elonga A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un hôtelier, âgée de 48 ans, mère 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de friperies au marché secondaire de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va acheter 5 ballons de friperies. Elle  souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Sikuliwako is a retailer and member of the loan group 'Elonga A', which works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 48 years old, married to a hotel keeper and has five children who all attend school.  She began her business with money she received from her husband.
