Sikuliwako has been selling second hand clothing in the second market in town for two years.  This loan will enable her to buy five bales of second hand clothing.

In the future, Sikuliwako would like to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.  She is very grateful to Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy 5 bales of second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Napoleon Humberto

texts.es: Napoleón de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos,  el se dedica al cultivo de guayaba y tomate, su hijo mayor le ayuda en el trabajo,  posee muchos años de experiencia el cual inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, pesticidas, etc. para poder cosechar un buen cultivo y así tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Napoleón is 65 years old and lives in his own home with his two children.  He grows guavas and tomatoes; his older son helps him with the work; he has many years of experience and he started with his own capital.  He sells his produce in the neighborhoods surrounding the area where he lives and with his earnings from sales he is able to cover some of his household expenses.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manures, pest control, herbicides, pesticides, etc. so he can harvest a good crop and make better profits for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manures, pest control, herbicides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: A sus 18 años de edad Juan es un joven que termino la secundaria y no pudo seguir la universidad debido a la  falta de recursos economicos de sus padres, Juan crecio en el campo y comenta que sus padres son quienes le anseñan a la actividad de la agricultura, Juan hace un año atrás empezo a sembrar pequeñas huertas de productos propios de su localidad, Juan solicita el credito ya que lo necesita para comprar abono y fungicidas para sus cultivos, Juan tiene propuesta la meta  de seguir en sus cultivos y llegar a ser un gran agricultor.
texts.en: At 18 years old, Juan is a young man who finished secondary school and was not able to go to university because his parents did not have the financial resources.  Juan grew up in the country and tells us that his parents are the ones who taught him the farming business.  A year ago, Juan started to plant small gardens of produce that grows in the area.  Juan is requesting this loan because he needs it to buy fertilizer and fungicides for his crops.  Juan's goal is to keep on planting and become a great farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides

loans.name: Rovert

texts.es:
Rovert tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con sus 02 hijos y su cónyuge en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad rural dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cerdos y patos, realiza esta actividad desde hace 8 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Además brinda servicio de transporte en su mototaxi. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Rovert espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rovert is 34 years old, in a common-law relationship, and lives with his wife and two children in the District of Cayaltí. This rural community is dedicated to trade and agriculture. It is located in Chiclayo Province in the region of Lambayeque, which is situated on the northern coast of Peru.

Rovert raises and sells animals, such as pigs and ducks. He has been in this business for eight years and has the necessary experience. Rovert has received good personal and work-related references from people in his district. In addition, he provides transportation services with the use of a motorcycle taxi. His loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals, as well as balanced feed for fattening them. With this loan, Rovert hopes to offer a wider variety of animals to his customers so that he can increase his income level and eventually improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Cristina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Se requested a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

Cristina has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 33 years old, is married, and has five children, three of whom are currently in school.

Charlyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs. She has been in the pig-fattening business for 10 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Charlyn would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Savean's Group

texts.en: The members of Savean’s Group live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Savean makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Honn's Group

texts.en: The members of Honn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Honn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en: The members of Nim’s Group live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Nim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women  safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: The members of Sokha’s Group live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Sokha makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo, 39, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Rustic, is self-employed, and has one child in high school. He works hard to provide for his family and to send his child to school.

Eduardo owns and operates his own jeepney transportation service. He has one jeepney (14-16 person capacity). Jeepneys are the most common and cheapest form of public transportation throughout the many islands of the Philippines. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the Second World War and are still to be seen throughout the country, in many colors and all over the place. The Filipinos, being creative, saw the possibility to turn these vehicles into a real form of transportation by making them about two meters longer and by putting in two long seats, one on each side, from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses for the cheap transportation of people, goods, and sometimes even little animals.

To help him continue operating his business, Eduardo is requesting a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which he will use for the maintenance and registration of his jeepney. It is very important that his unit always be in good running condition to ensure efficient service. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that he will receive.

Eduardo hopes to buy another jeepney unit. He dreams of giving his child the best education. He prays for his and his passengers' safety in every trip. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance and registration of his jeepney.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA COMO OPERARIA PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR Y SACAR ADELANTE A SU FAMILIA ELLA TUVO QUE SALIR DE SU TRABAJO POR UN FUERTE DOLOR DE MUELA. ESTE PROBLEMA LE IMPIDE SEGUIR LABORANDO, ELLA QUIERE ATENDERSE PARA TRABAJAR ARDUAMENTE Y SOLVENTAR LOS GASTOS DE SU HOGAR.
texts.en:
This woman works for a company as an operator so that she can help her husband with the household expenses and move their family forward. She had to leave work due to a sharp pain in one of her molars. This problem is preventing her from continuing her work.

She wants to attend to his problem so that she can work hard and contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Islian Jamileth

texts.es: El negocio con el que se gana la vida Islian de 29 años de edad es la venta de productos de belleza y cuidado personal, dicha actividad ella la realiza desde hace 8 años y sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, pero además vende ropa y joyería de enchape, lo que le permite aprovechar mejor sus clientes. Junto a Islian viven sus dos hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad y su compañero de vida que siempre le brinda su apoyo económico, lo que le permite brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. La venta de productos de belleza y cuidado personal es muy rentable, por lo que Islian obtiene muy buenas ganancias, es por ello que desea invertir más en su negocio y de esta manera seguir superando sus propias metas, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: productos de belleza y cuidado personal, joyería de enchape y ropa para vender con sus vecinos y de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The business with which Islian, who is 29 years old, makes a living is the sale of beauty and personal care products. She has had this occupation for 8 years, and her main clients are her neighbors. She also sells clothing and ceramic jewelry, which allows her to get more benefits from her clients. Islian’s two children live with her, they are 14 and 6, and her life partner, who always brings her economic support, which allows her to bring better life conditions to her children. The sale of beauty and healthcare products is very profitable, which is why Islian obtains a good profit. This is why she wishes to invest in her business, and in this way, keep achieving her own goals. Because of this, she asks for a loan from FUSAI, to invest in: beauty and health care products, ceramic jewelry, and clothing to sell with her neighbors, and in this way obtain a better income.

loans.use: Tto invest in beauty and personal care products, ceramic jewelry, and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more "loroco" vine wholesale.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es una mujer de 32 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 13y 17 años de edad, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Candelaria es una mujer muy entusiasta que para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los  gastos de la casa se dedica a la crianza de pollos criollos, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace 14 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  a lavar ropa  con sus vecinos.
Candelaria ahora ha tomado la iniciativa de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, construyendo un cuarto donde sus hijos puedan descansar mejor, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar sus materiales, por tal razón solicita un crédito  que lo utilizara para comprar block, cemento y hierro.
Candelaria anhela poder comprar más  terrenos y construir locales para poder mejorar sus ingresos y tener contar con negocio de herrería.
texts.en:
Candelaria, 32, is married and has a beautiful family of three children between the ages of 13 and 17.  The family lives in a community in Solola.

Candelaria is a very enthusiastic woman who raises Creole chickens in order to earn an income and help her husband with the household expenses.  She has been in business for 14 years.  To earn extra income she also does laundry for her neighbors.

Now Candelaria has taken the initiative to improve her family's quality of life by building a room for one of her children to be more comfortable.  The difficulty she has is that she does not have enough money to buy the materials she needs.  Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy blocks, cement and iron.

Candelaria aspires to buying more land to build spaces where she can earn more income, such as a hardware business.

loans.use: To buy blocks, cement and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Lorena Maritza

texts.es: Lorena con 29 años de edad se gana la vida desde hace 2 años con la venta de perfumes, los cuales compra al contado cada mes, lo que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad en vivienda propia. La venta de perfumes de Lorena cuenta con una buena rentabilidad, ya que sus productos son de excelente calidad, por lo que no alcanza a cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan, es por ello que ha decidido invertir en su negocio ya que sabe que de esta manera logrará obtener mejores ingresos económicos y cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en perfumes para vender y así obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lorena, 29, has been earning a living for two years selling perfumes which she buys every month in cash.  She has been able to support her household economy this way.  She and her life partner live with their one-year-old son in their own home.  Perfume sales is very profitable for Lorena since her products are of excellent quality; such that she is unable to fulfill demand and so has decided to invest more in the business which she knows will give her more income.

Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy perfumes to sell and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs, animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs, animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Dolis Argelia

texts.es: Dolis es una mujer de 50 años de edad que siempre se esfuerza por llevar el sustento a su hogar, por medio de su negocio de venta de verduras, actividad que realiza desde hace 9 años, recorriendo las calles de su municipio, por lo que sus clientes siempre la esperan para adquirir sus productos. Ella vive junto a sus 2 hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace muchos años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder brindarles un techo donde vivir. Dolis desea invertir en su negocio, ya que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que cada día le demanda una mayor cantidad de productos, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tomates, aguacates, cebollas, chile verde, brócoli, güisquiles, etc.
texts.en:
Dolis is a 50 year old woman that always strives to bring food to her home through her business selling vegetables. She has done this for 9 years, walking the streets of her town so that her clients can expect to purchase her products. 

She lives with her two children, 17 and 15 years old, in their own home that they have had for many years. She feels happy to be able to provide a roof for them to live under. 

Dolis wants to invest in her business, since she counts on a good quantity of clients that ask her for a greater number of products every day. For this reason, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: tomatoes, avocados, onions, green chiles, broccoli, güisquiles, etc.

loans.use: to invest in tomatoes, avocados, onions, green chiles, broccoli, güisquiles, etc.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Emilia has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Emilia requested a PHP 150,00 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Emilia has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is 52 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Fausta works very hard to provide for them.

Fausta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, juice and candies to sell.

Fausta has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee and detergent to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Maris

texts.en:
Gloria Maris is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is 50 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gloria Maris has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Gloria Maris has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gloria Maris would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a 52 year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Haydee has a business making rugs and doormats in the Philippines. Haydee requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric and thread for her business.

Haydee has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Haydee would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Shela Me

texts.en:
Shela Me is 32 years old and married with two children.

Shela Me works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Shela Me has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Shela Me aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ofelia is 50 years old and three of her children are in school.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a 10,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 53 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Shirley is borrowing 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Shirley has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Yuan

texts.en:
Yuan is a 22-year-old woman who works with her husband to sell fruits and vegetables. They have a little daughter, who is two years old, and raised by her mother at home. Yuan and her husband were born into poor families and have not received much education. They devoted themselves to work when they finished high school. 

Because Yuan and her husband didn’t have much professional knowledge, they were not able to hunt for a good job. After conducting long-term market research, Yuan and her husband decided to sell fruits and vegetables. They purchase the stock four to five times every month in another city. They do this every month, and every time the transportation costs are very high. 

Yuan requested ￥15,000 from MicroCred. She wants to use the money to stock fruits and vegetables. Although her family did not leave much wealth to Yuan and her husband, Yuan has a hard-working spirit. She believes that with the help of MicroCred, her life will become better and better.

loans.use: to stock fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Vany's Group

texts.en: Vany’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Vany makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y su hija en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad agrícola donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, pollos, patos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de patos, cuyes, gallinas, cerdos, pavos, entre otros, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old and married. She owns a house located in a rural area in the Oyotún district, where she lives with her husband and her daughter. Locals work in agriculture, commerce, and raising animals. The district belongs to the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

Rosa has been raising and selling small farm animals at home, such as hens, chickens, and ducks for ten years.

She is requesting a loan to buy more ducks, guinea pigs, hens, pigs, turkeys, etc. Her objective is to expand her business and be able to better fulfill her customers’ needs. This will result in a better income and will help her to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more ducks, hens, pigs, etc. and expand her business.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, tiene 18 años de experiencia su padre fue quien le ayudo con el cultivo, vende sus productos en enero y febrero a los comerciantes de la zona donde ella reside, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder empezar a realizar las siembras y asi poder tener mejores cosechas para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Norma, 33, owns a house where she lives with her husband and four children. She has been growing corn and beans for eighteen years. Her father helped her to start with this activity. She sells her products in January and February, to local businesspeople.

Norma is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and improve the plot shown in the picture. She will be able to start sowing. She will have better harvests and her income will improve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and improve her plot.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and has a business selling charcoal and firewood in the Philippines. Jocelyn works hard to support her family and has been in this business for 11 years.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 46 year-old married woman with seven children, six of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a business buying and reselling soft drinks business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional cases of soft drinks to resell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional cases of soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old, married and has five children. 

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs and ducks in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs and ducks for two years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Erlinda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Ronalie

texts.en:
Ronalie is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. Ronalie has been in this business for 2 years now.

Ronalie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell. 

In the future, Ronalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 45 years old and is married with two children.

Ma. Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years.

Ma. Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 50 years old and married with six children. With four children still in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Rosalina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, diapers, shampoo and fabric conditioners. 

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 24 years old and married with one child.

Hazel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Hazel has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Hazel aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 56 years old and married with three children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack food, personal care products, school supplies and other groceries.

Alicia has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Alicia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, personal care products, school supplies and other groceries.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 55 years old and married with four children.

Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from poultry.

Cristina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Cristina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 32 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Janice is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Janice has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from selling frozen food.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeneve

texts.en:
Jeneve was able to utilize her previous loan to buy more grocery items and other supplies she needed to improve her sari-sari (convenience) store. She was also able to increase her profit and repay all her debts and daily expenses.

She is thankful to all the lenders who put their trust on her and she is asking again for your assistance for her new loan. This new loan will buy additional supplies of tires needed by vehicle owners. Her customers will be more likely to buy more items if she offers a choice of different but affordable and durable tires. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which means her business will become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

Jeneve wants to increase the profit from her business. She expects to give her children a better future as she expands her business. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional tires to sell for use in public transport vehicles.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 49 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Fortunata is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising livestock for six years and also earns additional income from selling food.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Yolanda has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from selling food.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Norsita

texts.en:
Norsita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Norsita has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 46 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from working in a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's handbags and flat shoes (ballerinas).

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз серьезная и шустрая женщина. Ей 32 лет. Она замужем и 2 сыновей, и 3 дочерей. Сыновьям 12 и 10 лет. Дочкам 13, 5 и 4 лет. Старшие дети учатся в средней школе. Муж строительный мастер. Он ремонтирует дома. Дилафруз у себя дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она 2 года продвигает свою работу. Дилафруз зарабатывает на жизнь, она помогает мужу обеспечить семьи. Она решила отремонтировать дом, но Дилафруз не смогла копить достаточную сумму денег для ремонта. Сейчас Дилафруз просит кредит для купли стройматериалов, чтобы отремонтировать дом, и жить комфортно как другие жители района. Дилафруз верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a serious and bright woman. She is 32 years old. She is married and has two sons and three daughters. Her sons are twelve and ten years old. Her daughters are thirteen, five, and four years old. Her oldest children attend middle school. Her husband is a construction foreman. He renovates homes. 

Dilafruz makes women's clothes from home. She has been pushing forward with this job for two years. Dilafruz is working for a living, and she is helping her husband to provide for their families. 

She has decided to renovate their home, but Dilafruz has not been able to save enough money for the renovations. Now Dilafruz is requesting a loan in order to buy building materials, so that she can renovate her home and live comfortably like the other residents of the area. Dilafruz believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials and renovate her home

loans.name: Dora Edith

texts.es:
Dora tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar los servicios de crianza y venta de animales, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 2 años, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio así como para realizar reparaciones en el lugar donde los cría, dicha inversión le servirá para mejorar su negocio y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is 30 years old. She is in a common law marriage. She lives with her family in the district of Oyotún in a rural area where life is peaceful and the residents work in agriculture and livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

She raises and sells animals. She has done this activity for more than 2 years. She has good personal and work references in her district. She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of animals to increase her business inventory, as well as to make repairs on the place where she raises them. Said investment will help improve her business and that way she can serve the different needs of area customers, which will generate more income. That will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase her business inventory, as well as to make repairs on the place where she raises them.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee un negocio de venta de comida desde hace mas de 15 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso cerámico, pero con lo que obtiene de sus venas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de cemento, cerámica, arena y pago de mano de obra y así ella y su esposo puedan vivir más cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en: Teresa lives in her own house with her husband. She has had a business selling food for 15 years. WIth what she obtains from her work, she is able to cover some of her household expenses. She wants to improve her hoe by putting in a tile floor. What she gets from her sales isn't enough to do this, so that is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy cement, ceramic tiles, sand and to pay for labor. This way, she and her husband can live more comfortably and cleanly.

loans.use: to buy cement, ceramic tile, sand and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
This is Cirila, 37, and resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Glen, a foreman, and they have children.  

She manages her own household while operating her business. She works hard to augment their income to meet the family’s daily personal and household needs and provide for the education of her children. 

Cirila has had a buy and sell business for three years already. She buys gallons of mineral water and frozen chicken and hotdogs from a wholesaler and sells them at retail prices. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 8,000 in sales every day.  

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to pay for mineral water and frozen foods such as chicken and hot dogs to sell at her small store by her house. She is positive that she will have a good return on her investment. She is also thanking God in advance for the financial help, for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and her children's education.

Cirila hopes to grow her business and improve their standard of living. She aims to give her children a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gallons of mineral water and frozen foods.

loans.name: Guluipa

texts.ru: Гулуйпа, 24 года, замужем, есть сын. У Гулуйпы среднее образование, она вместе с супругом занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 2 коровы, лошадь. Также есть 1,04 ГА собственной и 0,40 Га арендованной поливной земли, на участке стоят теплицы, где она выращивает кукурузу, перец, помидоры для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулуйпа обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян огурцов и удобрений для выращивания экологически чистых овощей. Доходы от кредита Гулуйпа планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Guluipa is 24 years old, married, and has a son. Guluila has secondary education. Together with her spouse, she works in animal husbandry and agriculture. 

Thanks to Guluipa's persistent hard work, today the farm has two cows and a horse. She also owns 1.04 hectares and rents 0.40 hectares of irrigated land. On part of the land there are greenhouses, in which Guluipa cultivates corn, peppers, and tomatoes for sale.

In order to further develop her business, Guluipa has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 Som (KGS). This is to buy cucumber seeds and fertilisers in order to grow organic vegetables. Guluipa plans to invest the finance from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy cucumber seeds and fertilizers for growing organic vegetables

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 52 years old and married. She has five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rebecca has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Rebecca is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries for the clearing and land preparation for her farm.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for the clearing and land preparation for her farm.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia es una señora de 52 años de edad, es viuda y tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 18 y 35 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Lucia a pesar de ser viuda trabaja para mantener a su familia, ella tiene 20 años de elaborar trajes típicos de su región, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  a la venta de refacción en su comunidad, gracias a estas dos actividades a sacado adelante a sus hijos.
Lucia es una madre que se preocupa mucho por las necesidades de su familia y para que ellos algún día tengan donde cultivar, ahora ha pensado en comprar media cuerda de terreno donde ahora va a cultivar árboles, aunque una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder realizar la compra por tal motivo solicita un crédito.
Lucia sueña con poder construir un muro donde está viviendo para seguir construyendo habitaciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 52 year old woman. She is a widow and has a beautiful family of two children, aged 18 and 35. This beautiful family lives in the community of Sololá. Despite being a widow, Lucia works to support her family. For 20 years, she has been making traditional dresses from her region, but in order to improve her income she also sells snacks in her community. Thanks to these two activities, she has gotten her children ahead. 

Lucia is a mother who is very concerned with the needs of her family. In order for them to have somewhere to farm one day, she is now planning on buying a half acre of land where she can grow trees. One of the difficulties she has is not having enough capital to make the purchase and that is why she is asking for the loan. 

Lucia dreams of being able to build a wall where she is living so she can keep building rooms in her house.

loans.use: to buy land to grow trees.

loans.name: Dilfuzahon

texts.en:
Dilfuzahon is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in a small village with her big family. She is married and has three children. DIlfuzahon is a responsible, honest and hospitable person. 

For about 15 years, she and her husband have done a business buying and selling home use goods like soap, washing powders, hair dye, etc. She works hard and has permanent clients every day. 

Dilfuzahon and her husband have some difficulties with finance because what they earn is not enough to pay living expenses like clothes and food. She wants to educate and raise her children well. 

Dilfuzahon decided to enlarge her business and earn more money to live better. She requested financial support from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy goods for selling. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy home use goods like soap, washing powders,  hair dye, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 55 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Susan requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Adnelia

texts.en:
Adnelia is a widow and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. 

Adnelia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adnelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Melry is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  

Melry is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Melry has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

Gina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of rice to offer for sale.

NWTF is re-listing Gina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 72 years old and widow with nine children.

Erlinda is in the agricultural businesses, farming sugarcane and raising pigs in the Philippines.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain it. 

Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy mangoes.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a generous woman. She was born in Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in small village with her family. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an emigrant and the money that he sends to her is not enough to feed a family, because of the exchange rate. 

She has her own small business of sewing traditional women's dresses at home. She works hard in order to care for her children. Her daughters are helping her to do business. She has had permanent clients for about 14 years. 

Mahbuba needs to repair her house because her daughters are growing up and traditionally she will give them in marriage. She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to get a loan to buy sand, cement, bricks and masonry to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks and masonry to repair her house.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 18 years. He describes himself as innovative. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a favourable area and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to own a fleet of motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his family's well being. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined. 

John operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to have a chain of boutiques within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is a skillful woman. She was born in Tajikistan in 1994. She is living in a small town in the southern part of the country. She is single and lives with her parents. In her young age she does business and has years of experience. She has her small store where she trades nutrition products like drinks, oil, batter, candies, bread, etc. She also had practice trading in the village. 

Nargiza is a responsible, honest, kind and gentle person. She needs to enlarge her business in order to help her parents with finances. 

She appealed to IMON and KIVA lenders to buy grocery products. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy grocery products and help her parents with finances

loans.name: Lolahon

texts.en:
Lolahon is a creative woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a small town. She is married and has four children. 

When she was a child she watched her mother as she was sewing. She liked this activity very much and had dreamed to be like her. Lolahon has 10 years of experience sewing traditional women's dresses. She kept that ability, doing her job with love and patience. Now she has permanent customers for her dresses every day. 

Lolahon is asking financial support from KIVA lenders to buy construction supplies like cement, bricks, send, wood, etc. She wants to repair her room where she sews her dresses. She considers that it is not convenient to take clients in her bad condition room. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies like cement, bricks, send, wood, etc

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be visionary. 

He operates a retail business where he sells bread, sugar, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be less space in the shop. 

Tony will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. 

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. Jennifer is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Charmaine

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Charmaine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and selling dry goods.  

Charmaine is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to  buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, eggs, etc for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Charmaine has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, eggs, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elizabeth has been farming sugarcane for 11 years, and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Bramwel

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Bramwel, a youthful, 29-year-old honest man, who is a father to three good-looking children. He is based in Kaplamai, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This is an area with high poultry production and consumption. 

For three years, Bramwel has been actively involved in mixed farming as a source of income. He has a beautiful and supportive wife, who helps him with farm work and domestic chores. His primary sources of income are milk, crops, and some personal business that he does to make ends meet. He passionately loves poultry farming, and this can be noticed in how he takes good care of his poultry birds and feeds them. When he was asked what he enjoys about poultry farming, he replied that he enjoys “picking up the eggs every day in the morning.” 

However, this humble and honest man faces challenges of not meeting the demand for eggs, and not satisfying his ever-increasing client base. That is why he is requesting a loan: to buy good quality breeds of poultry birds. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture, and the demand for chicken is always high, because it is such a popular meal for so many people. In addition to earning increased profits, Bramwel will benefit from poultry manure, which will save him some money that he otherwise would have used to buy fertilizer. With the increased income from selling eggs, poultry meat, and feathers, he will permanently change his living conditions and secure the future of his school-going children.

Kindly help him out!

loans.use: to buy poultry birds of a high-quality breed.

loans.name: Jérémie Group

texts.fr: Isab est une femme d’affaires et propriétaire d’un cabinet de change de la monnaie dans un rond point ville depuis 11 ans, membre du groupe de crédits «Jérémie», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 45 ans, mère de 8 enfants tous vont à l’école. Il commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un chauffeur des véhicules poids lourds. Elle va acheter la monnaie locale. Elle souhaite, accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes non bancables.
texts.en: Isab is a businesswoman and has been owner of a currency exchange office located on a city roundabout for 11 years.  She is member of the Jeremie loan group, a client of IMF Hekima. Isab is married, 45-years old, and mother of 8 children who all attend school. She started her business with funds received from her husband.  Her spouse is a driver of heavyweight vehicles.  Isab will buy local currency. She wishes to grow her business revenues, send her children to school and to feed them.  To conclude, she thanks Hekima for their support of women not served by traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy local currency.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor for those building the house

loans.name: Jose Cruz

texts.es: José de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, posee más de 17 años de experiencia en el cultivo el cual inicio con capital propio, almacena su cosecha en los graneros que muestra la fotografía y luego los vende a finales del año en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, etc. que le servirán para tener una buena cosecha y asi tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He makes a living by growing corn and has more than 17 years of farming experience. José founded his business with his own capital. He stores his crop in the barn shown in the photograph and sells it at the end of the year in the markets near his home. José uses his earnings to pay for some of his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticides, etc. to help him have a good harvest, improve his earnings, and thus have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Hitaf

texts.en:
Hitaf is a 28-year-old divorced woman, living with her parents. She is the main income provider in her family. She has owned a grocery store since 2014. Her shop is situated next to her house where she welcomes customers from different areas and villages to buy her fresh goods. Today, Hitaf is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to increase her store’s inventory. 

Hitaf says that the loan will surely help her extend her trade and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: to increase her grocery store’s inventory.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 22-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband; she has no children. Her husband is the main income provider for the family; he owns a barber shop. 

Caroline decided in 2011 to start her own business, so she opened a beauty salon in her town where she provides hairdressing and beautician services. Today, with the aim to develop her job, she is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase beauty products and to renovate her shop. 

She said that after taking the loan she will be able to attract more customers and therefore, increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and to renovate her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jonathan Ivan

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive el señor Jonathan, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, una de 8 años y un bebé de 3 meses de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela. Su mujer es auditora.  
Don Jonathan es Ing. Civil y está realizando obras para el estado, pero como no tiene mucho tiempo ejerciendo requiere de muchas herramientas para que sus albañiles puedan realizar su labor de una manera más rápida y eficiente, el también utiliza el crédito para comprar cemento, arena y otros materiales que el emplea en la culminación de sus obras ya que en ocasiones los anticipos por obras no alcanzan para continuar con los trabajos y es ahí que gracias a los créditos él puede cumplir a tiempo con los trabajos, son varias las personas que trabajan con él, estas familias al igual que el pueden llevar el pan a sus hogares.
Este crédito es para comprar, herramientas y materiales de construcción, el lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le agrada por la rapidez y bajos intereses de los créditos. Sus sueños son tener una gran empresa constructora.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Grupo De Crédito La Mocora get together in the town of La Mocora of the Colon parish, a place known for its hard-working people dedicated to agriculture and livestock. 

Here lives Jonathan, who is 30 years old and is in a common-law marriage of which he has two children, one 8 year old and one 3 month old baby. The older one is in school. His wife is an auditor. Jonathan is a civil engineer and is carrying out jobs for the state, but since he hasn't had much practice, he needs a lot of tools so that his builders can do their work more quickly and efficiently.  

He will also use the loan to buy cement, sand and other materials that he uses in the completion of his jobs, because sometimes the money advances for the work are not enough to continue with the jobs, and thanks to the loans he can finish the jobs on time. There are various people that work with him and just like him they can make a living. 

This loan is to buy tools and construction materials. He has done 3 loan cycles with the Grupo de Crédito and he thanks them for the quickness and low interests of the loans. His dream is to have a big construction company.

loans.use: to buy tools and construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the toilet and buy a water tank.

loans.name: Elidia

texts.es:
Elidia tiene 58 años de edad, vive en casa propia en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 6 años. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerveza para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Elidia espera ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes lo que mejorará su nivel de ingresos y por ende le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elidia, 58, lives in her own house in a commercial, agricultural, and ranching community located in the district of Cayaltí in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She earns a living selling beer as well as rice, sugar, and other groceries.  She has been in this business for more than six years.

Elidia's loan is to buy a large quantity of beer to increase the stock in her business.  She hopes with this to be able to offer her customers a wider variety of products, which will improve her income and, as a result, allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beer to increase her stock

loans.name: Beberly

texts.en:
Beberly is 23 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Beberly works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Beberly has been in this business for one year.

In the future Beberly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell, like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fetilizer that will help boost productivity thus more income to support family needs.

loans.name: Romualdo

texts.es:
Romualdo es un hombre de 55 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 27 y 30 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de San Antonio Palopo.
Romualdo es una persona muy trabajadora que para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica al cultivo de café, esta actividad lo realiza el desde hace 30 años, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos también cultiva maíz y tomate.
Romualdo ahora tiene la necesidad de un crédito porque no cuenta con suficiente dinero para poder comprar su fertilizante y pagar la mano de obra para el mantenimiento de su maíz y café.
Él tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder darle mantenimiento a su cultivo así mismo para poder obtener muy buena cosecha y comprar más terrenos para construir su casa.
texts.en: Romualdo is a 55-year-old man. He is married and has a beautiful family of three children aged between 27 and 30. They live in the community of San Antonio Palopo. Romualdo is very hard-working and supports his family by growing coffee. He has been in the business for 30 years and supplements his income by growing corn and tomatoes. Romualdo now requires a loan because he does not have enough money to purchase fertilizer and pay for the labor costs needed to maintain his corn and coffee plants. He is hopeful that he may receive the loan to maintain his crops and thus have a good harvest that enables him to buy more land to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor costs needed to maintain his coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy an additional posho mill that will help boost income thus cater for family needs with ease.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorcycle taxis, which are currently in disrepair.

loans.name: Señor De Los Nevados Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS NEVADOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yony continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua cultivando papa, quinua y maíz, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abono.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Señor de los Nevados" community bank. This bank is located in the Paucartambo district belonging to the Paucartambo province and Cusco department.

The member is Yony. She continues to dedicate herself to farming. She is a responsible and hard working person. She continues growing potato, quinoa, and maize. She has spent many years dedicating herself to this business which is going well thanks to the effort she puts forth every day for it. She wishes to be able to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers. The other members are dedicated to businesses selling animals, selling vegetables, a grocery store and a business selling food.

The member is thankful to those who form part of this dream in this way and promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers..

loans.name: Kantuta Aymara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTA AYMARA” iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ines es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de biblias, venta de coca, venta de joyas, venta de puertas, venta de ollas, venta comida, venta CD’s, servicio de transporte. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ines es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al  ingresar a la asociación de cocaleros donde le inscribió su suegra. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra coca por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad de la obtención del crédito que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se observa la ausencia de una cliente, la misma se fue con premura a su domicilio
texts.en:
The Kantuta Aymara community bank will begin its 29th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal of Alto Lima. It is made up of nine members and is directed by a board where Ines is the President. The businesses that the members of the community association manage are varied. Among them are: selling Bibles, selling coca, selling jewelry, selling doors, selling pots, selling food, selling CDs, and transportation service.

The loan will benefit small businesses where Ines is a member. She indicated that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling coca. She discloses that she started this business many years ago upon joining the association of coca growers where her mother-in-law enrolled.

The loan she will now take is to expand capital (to buy coca at wholesale) that she will acquire from vendors in the city of La Paz and later selling from her selling space. This type of work allows her to earn income to support her family economically since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the ease with which she can obtain a loan that the institution offers.

In the photo, one client is absent as she had to hurry home.

loans.use: to buy coca at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS BLANCAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Candelaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pasankallas, venta de comida, venta de puertas, venta de cerveza, venta de fruta, venta de CD’s. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Candelaria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años emprendiendo este negocio por iniciativa de su amiga que le guió en el establecimiento de este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta ausente una de la cliente, la misma se fue a su negocio con premura.
texts.en:
The ROSAS BLANCAS community association will start their fifth lending cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Focal Centre. It is composed of eight members and is headed by a board of directors in which Candelaria is its president. The businesses of the members of the community association are varied and include: sale of pasankallas [a variety of popcorn], sale of food, sale of doors, sale of beer, sale of fruit and sale of CDs.

The loan will benefit small business owners including Candelaria. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, entering after being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling food. She tells that she started this business a few years ago, starting it by her friend's initiative who guided her in starting the business.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her capital (purchase of potatoes wholesale), which she will buy from the saleswomen in the city of La Paz, and after preparing them, she will sell them in her shop. This way of working allows her to generate resources to economically support her family, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the healthcare area of the institution.

One of the members of the group is missing from the picture, who went early to her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Bonanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BONANZA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lorena es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de busos, venta de ropa, venta de alcohol, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de busos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lorena es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa americana; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años aprendiendo la venta de su madrina, quien trabajaba en el mismo negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decidió iniciar su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Bonanza community bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal of Collpani. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Lorena is the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the community association manage are varied. Among them are: selling buses, selling clothing, selling alcohol, a neighborhood store, selling blankets, selling sweaters.

The loan that they will take will benefit small businesses where Lorena is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago, joining at the invitation of an assessor from the institution who visited her at home. Currently, she has a business selling American clothing.  She discloses that she started this business several years ago learning sales from her mother who worked in the same business. With the passage of time, she decided to start her own business.

The loan that she is now taking is to expand capital (buy clothing at wholesale) that she will acquire from the vendors in the city of El Alto and later will sell from her selling space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically since she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad,  la menor de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Rosa junto al esposo tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí ellos venden víveres de toda clase como  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes, ciertas cosas de bazar,  agua en bidón sodas, golosinas.
